name: "Luna" Herb-Infused Raw Honey
description:
This honey was crafted with peace and calming in mind. There’s nothing quite like the comfort of a cup of lavender tea or the scent of lavender on a summer day.

This raw honey was slowly infused with organic lavender flowers.

It is DELICIOUS and has a gentle lavender flavor profile.

The honey can be used any way you would normally use honey:

  • Drizzled on pancakes

  • On biscuits with a little butter

  • In cookies or protein bites

  • To sweeten teas or iced tea

  • To rim a glass for an herbal mocktail

  • As a garnish for a charcuterie board

  • Swirled into a London fog drink

  • As a gentle face mask (apply and leave on for 5-10 minutes!)

And more!

The honey comes in a 4oz. amber glass jar, but the honey itself weighs 5.5oz.

name: "Sol" - Herb-infused Raw Honey
description:
This honey was crafted with my favorite hibiscus lemonade blend in mind!

This raw honey was slowly infused with all organic or wildcrafted:

  • Hibiscus

  • Nettle Leaf

  • Lemon Peel

  • Cayenne Pepper

  • Chili Powder

It originally started out as a bright, hibiscus honey but after my friends taste-tested it, we agreed it needed a bit of spice to round out the flavor profile. The honey has a tart top note of hibiscus, followed by a slight bitterness from the lemon peel, and earthiness from the nettle. It has a flavor that’s really similar to Chamoy, a Mexican condiment that is usually made from pickled fruit, lime juice, chili powder, and salt. It is a childhood flavor for me! The spice profile is there, but now in an overwhelming way. If you can tolerate the occasional jalapeño spice in your food you can for SURE tolerate this honey by itself! It is sweet but has that warmth to finish it off.

It is DELICIOUS.

The honey can be used any way you would normally use honey:

  • Drizzled on pancakes

  • On biscuits with a little butter

  • In cookies or protein bites

  • To sweeten teas or iced tea

  • To rim a glass for an herbal mocktail

  • As a garnish for a charcuterie board

  • As a dip for fruits like pineapple, green apples, and mangoes

And more!

The honey comes in a 4oz. amber glass jar, but the honey itself weighs 5.5oz.

name: "Terra" - Herbal Electuary
description:
This honey was crafted with my favorite beverage (spiced chai) in mind.

This blend was also formulated to feel like a warm hug for a frazzled nervous system. The herbs and spices used are known for their warming and soothing effect on the body.

An electuary is a mixture of herbs and raw honey and is a traditional method to consume herbs with ease. The honey beautifully brings the flavors together and suspends the herbs. Electuaries can be thick enough to roll into a lozenge, or thin enough to pour. This electuary falls somewhere in between! It has a paste texture.


This raw electuary contains all organic or wildcrafted:

  • Ashwagandha

  • Cardamom

  • Clove

  • Ginger

  • Ceylon cinnamon

  • Vanilla

Electuraries can be consumed by the spoonful or can be drizzled over yogurt or stirred into a warm beverage. The texture of an electuary is a little gritty, as you are consuming larger amounts of herbs at once, but delivers the herbs to your body so quickly.

This electuary is earthy (which inspired the name!) and grounding, with that spice that you get from a spiced chai. My children consume it by the spoonful, and I prefer to mix it into 6oz of raw steamed milk for a cozy nightcap.

It is DELICIOUS.

The honey can be used any way you would normally use honey:

  • Drizzled on pancakes

  • On biscuits with a little butter

  • In cookies or protein bites

  • To sweeten teas

  • As a garnish for a charcuterie board

  • As a dip for fruits like apples or bananas

SERVING SUGGESTION: consume 1 tsp (7 grams) as desired. I like to mix it into a glass of steamed raw milk! You may add more to taste if a sweeter drink is desired.

SERVINGS PER CONTAINER: approximately 22 (7g) servings

SUPPLEMENT FACTS: one teaspoon contains approximately 270mg of ashwagandha

The honey comes in a 4oz. amber glass jar, but the honey itself weighs 5.5oz.

name: 12 oz Honeycomb Candle
description:
NOTE: our supplier was out of the normal pine lids, so this batch has black wooden lids!

Our 12 oz candle made with high-quality beeswax and 3 lead-free cotton wicks. It smells sweet like honey!  The jar has a beautiful honeycomb pattern on it that sparkles when the candle is burning.

Burn time is approximately 40 hours.

For best results, allow the candle to burn to the edge each time it burns. This can take up to 4 hours. This ensures that the candle will burn evenly and won’t create a “tunnel” of beeswax.

Trim the wick before each burn. You can trim the wick by pinching off the charred part with your fingers. This ensures your wick won’t burn too fast.

name: Acorn Beeswax Candle
description:
Burn time: 12-14 hours 

A darling 100% beeswax candle, dyed with eco-friendly and non-toxic dyes. We use cotton wicks!  For best results, please let it burn for 2-3 hours each time you light it, or to burn to the edge to avoid tunneling.

Measures approximately 2.5" by 2.5"

name: Adaptogenic Cacao - Cacao Calm
description:
ADAPTOGENIC HOT COCOA

A collaboration with Dancing Fern Folk Apothecary for Wild Oaks Apothecary.

This adaptogenic hot cocoa was created to honor the traditions of sipping chocolate that have existed for thousands of years. It’s a tradition that invites us to slow down and enjoy a warm beverage alone or with loved ones.

This is our take on a hot cocoa, with added adaptogens to help soothe your body and allow it to better adapt to the stressors found in life.

The mixture contains cocoa, ashwagandha, chaga, vanilla bean, cinnamon, and cardamom. It tastes chocolatey and creamy with a hint of "something more."

It comes unsweetened, so we recommend adding 2 tsp drink mix to 8ounces liquid of choice (raw milk!) along with 1-2 tablespoons sweetener of choice (I love raw sugar, Nicole loves maple syrup!) for a cozy drink.

A little about each ingredient:

Cacao - Used for thousands of years, cacao/cocoa has amazing benefits for the body. It can act as an aphrodisiac, help to lower blood pressure, and provides amazing antioxidants and minerals along with magnesium.

Ashwagandha - A beautiful root, ashwagandha can help to reduce stress, improve poor sleep, help to reduce inflammation, and can help with a wide variety of ailments in the body.

Chaga - An amazing mushroom, chaga can help to reduce inflammation in the body, provide anti-tumor benefits, reduce blood pressure, and promote overall immune support.

Vanilla - A yummy pod from an orchid plant, vanilla can help to calm the body, provide some magnesium, help to relax the body and increase happy hormones.

Cinnamon - A warming spice known for its help with digestion along with regulating high blood pressure and blood sugar.

Cardamom - A fragrant pod that can help reduce inflammation, help support digestion, bring antioxidant benefits to the body, and help support the liver.

comes in a pouch with 22 servings.

name: All Purpose Boost
description:
Sodium percarbonate is the only ingredient in this boost powder! It becomes washing soda and hydrogen peroxide (32.5% peroxide) when introduced to water.

When activated by water, it can be used to gently lift stains from a wide variety of items or to deodorize. It is a popular ingredient in many products that are meant for whitening and brightening, but I wanted to offer it as a single ingredient rather than mixed with other toxic filler ingredients.

To use, sprinkle a little of the boost on a stain and spritz with water, or you can make a paste and scrub it into the item. Allow it to sit for 20 minutes or up to 12 hours before washing as normal. I recommend doing a spot test first when using it on colored clothes to be sure it does not fade the fabric. 

As a laundry boost, you can add 1 to 2 tablespoons to your load of laundry. 

To strip thrifted clothes or clothes with a funky smell, fill a bathtub with HOT water to cover the clothes, then mix in 1/4c - 1/2c boost. Mix and allow to sit for up to 6 hours, then drain and wash as normal. You can add 1/4c laundry detergent to further help the stripping process.

For pots and pans, add 1 to 2 tablespoons to the pan, then add enough water to cover the granules (1 to 2 cups) and let it sit for 20 minutes or up to 12 hours. Scrub if needed, then rinse clean!  

You can also make a spray out of this to treat stains or funky smells. Mix 2 teaspoons of the granules with 16 ounces of water. This spray will be useful for around 5 hours before the active ingredients are no longer useful. 

You can use this on: 

- pots

- pans

- clothes 

- countertop stains

- grimy stovetops

- bathtubs

- showers

- toilets

- upholstery

- carpet cleaners 

and more!

Comes in a 32-ounce resealable pouch.

name: Allergies Blend
description:
This blend was crafted to support the body through seasonal allergies. The herbs and mushrooms in the blend have been traditionally used to support the body’s histamine response, sinuses, lungs, inflammation, kidneys, heart, digestion, and more. This blend may help the body’s response to environmental and seasonal allergies and may support healthy airways. It may support those with bronchitis or asthma, and those needing a gentle boost of energy or relief from fatigue.

Ingredients — Wildcrafted fresh goldenrod (solidago spp), wildcrafted wood-grown reishi fruiting body (ganoderma lucidum),* cordyceps fruiting body (cordyceps militaris),* grain alcohol, spring water, non-GMO palm-derived glycerin, raw honey *heated for full benefits

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass dropper bottle

name: Anise Hyssop Elixir
description:
Agastache Foeniculum

ABOUT:

Anise Hyssop may support the body through coughs and lung ailments. It may help to soothe and calm coughs and help to clear the sinuses of mucus. It can support the body through fevers and may help to promote relaxation in the body. It was traditionally used to support the body through the flu, diarrhea, colds, and sore throats. It can act as a bitter, which in turn supports the liver and acts as a digestive support. It also has a drying and slightly warming effect on the body, making it useful for damp conditions.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Antiviral Blend
description:
This trio is known for its ability to support the body through viruses. It can be used for HIV, EBV, cold sores, herpes, and other viruses that the body needs support to work through. This blend may provide gentle gut support, mood support, liver support, and an uplifting support to the body while also offering immune support. This blend may also offer nervous system support and help to calm the body.

NOTE: St. John’s Wort can metabolize medication too quickly and render it ineffective. It is best to research and see if it will counteract any prescription medication.

Ingredients — Wildcrafted fresh extracts of lemon balm (melissa officinalis), and St. John’s Wort (hypericum perforatum), wildcrafted, wood-grown turkey tail fruiting body* (trametes versicolor), grain alcohol, spring water, non-GMO palm-derived glycerin, raw honey *heated for full benefits

name: Apple  Tonic
description:
This tasty tonic is a good source of vitamins C, A, K, iron, calcium, magnesium, folate, potassium, zinc, and manganese. It can help replenish needed nutrients and may offer your daily dose of vitamins and minerals.

An oxymel is a combination of an acid and honey and is a potent way to extract vitamins and minerals and help the body retain hydration. It can be taken as digestive support before or after meals and as a delicious addition to your daily beverages.

INGREDIENTS
Raw apple cider vinegar, raw honey, fresh apples, Ceylon cinnamon,* cloves,* nutmeg,* vanilla bean,* fresh ginger root, black tea,* catnip,* lemon peel*

*dried

name: Apple Pie Candle
description:
Our herb-infused tallow candles were the first on the market, utilizing scents from herbs and spices without using essential oils.

Our new apple pie tallow and beeswax candle is a proprietary blend of herbs and spices. The ingredients are slowly infused with the tallow and beeswax to produce a yummy finished product!

They will not fill the room quite like a store-bought candles will, but they have a warm scent and are totally non-toxic.

SCENT PROFILE - This candle has a gentle nutmeg and spice aroma that reminds me of baked goods on an autumn day. It is warm and cozy.

CANDLE CARE - For best results, allow the candle to burn to the edge each time it burns. This can take up to 4 hours. This ensures that the candle will burn evenly and won’t create a “tunnel” of beeswax.

Trim the wick before each burn. You can trim the wick by pinching off the charred part with your fingers. This ensures your wick won’t burn too fast.

The candle comes in an 8-ounce amber glass jar with a lid.

name: Ashwagandha Root Tincture
description:
Ashwagandha is a root that has been used for centuries for its pain-relieving properties and more. It is said to be the single most important herb in Ayurvedic medicine, which comes from India.

You can read our in-depth article on Ashwagandha here.

As an adaptogen, ashwagandha can help the body better adapt to stress. It can also help those feeling depleted or stressed out, or that feeling of being frazzled and needing to take a weeklong nap. It can help support the body through stressful periods of time.

Ashwagandha can help to improve libido in men and women, and studies have shown that it can help raise testosterone levels in men. It can also help to raise the sperm count in men, making it a useful supplement for those working through fertility struggles. It has also been given to athletes to improve stamina!

For children, it can be used to promote growth and also to support overall vitality of their body.

Ashwagandha can help support healthier sleep patterns. It is one of the only herbs that can both provide energy and help to support restful sleep.

For those with high cholesterol or diabetes, you might benefit from taking this tincture!

It can help support healthy brain functions and help support thinking, creativity, and concentration abilities.

It can help to support the immune system by slowing down an overactive one, and gently boosting an underachieving immune system. It is a great supplement for those with autoimmune disorders and those with thyroid imbalances.

It can help to lower inflammation at its root, and help those with arthritis or fibromyalgia.

It is a beautiful support for anyone needing some nervous system love! It is well-studied and has been shown to be a beneficial root to consume. It is best when taken daily as it can work over time to support the body and its functions!

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Autumn Tallow
description:
I formulated this to capture the essence of autumn, and all the warm and cozy spices I associate with that season.

This has been a hit for 3 years now, since it was first released!

The herbs and spices all work to promote good circulation for the colder months, help with healing wounds and skin inflammation, and provide a cozy smell. All ingredients are organic or wildcrafted.

The texture is a light cream, easy to dip your finger into. It spreads easily and absorbs into the skin while helping to seal in moisture. A little goes a long way! The tea leaves also add a beautiful color to this product.

This is a seasonal product and will restock each drop until December 1st.

Comes in a 2oz amber glass jar.

INGREDIENTS

Tallow - Rich in vitamins A, D, K, E, and B12, along with palmitoleic acid, stearic acid, and oleic acid, tallow works to deeply moisturize and soothe all skin types. Tallow closely mimics the oil our skin naturally produces, making it non-comedogenic and suitable for all skin types. Tallow acts as a deep moisturizer, stimulating our cells to regrow.

Jojoba oil - a touch is added to make the whipping process easier. jojoba mimics the oil our skin produces and is non-pore-clogging. 

Spices - this cozy blend of spices helps with circulation, warming the skin during chilly months, and also provides anti-inflammatory benefits. They smell yummy, which also helps to boost your mood! Contains Ceylon cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, and clove.

Black Tea - rich in antioxidants that help to heal the skin, help with acne and blemishes, and can reduce and delay the signs of aging. It may also help to reduce puffiness. 

Beeswax - to help seal in moisture and stabilize the cream.

name: Bare - Herb-Infused Tallow Whip
description:
This whip has a buttery texture and a gentle scent, making it perfect for those who need some extra moisture without a strong herbal smell!

Buttery smooth and creamy, the ingredients work together to help provide moisture and offer support for rashes, skin conditions, and more! The herbs and tremella mushroom are known for their soothing, calming, and cooling actions.

This whip comes in a 2-ounce amber jar. PLEASE NOTE that the texture might change slightly when shipping to hot climates. If your whip arrives softer than it should be, place it in the fridge to cool for 20 minutes before applying.

INGREDIENTS - Locally sourced tallow, cold-pressed jojoba oil, nilotica shea butter, and beeswax infused with extracts from wildcrafted chamomile, marshmallow root, and tremella

name: Beeswax Cherry Candles
description:
These candles look good enough to eat!

Introducing our NEW cherry beeswax candles as part of our Summer Farmer’s Market candle collection!

Each cherry measures approximately 3/4” with a 2” stem that is the wick. Each set of 6 cherries comes in a cotton cloth drawstring bag.

The stem burns for approximately 45 seconds with enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” and each candle burns for approximately 45 minutes.

The cherries are crafted with pure beeswax, a lead-free cotton wick, and eco-friendly non-toxic dyes!

They would be darling for:

  • A summer birthday party candle

  • A hostess gift

  • A spring/summer picnic candle

  • Or just to enjoy as-is!

CANDLE CARE:

Please supervise the burn of these candles, as they burn quickly!

name: Beeswax Colored Egg Candles - Half Dozen
description:
These cute candles are made from 100% pure beeswax and a cotton, lead-free wick, dyed with natural eco-friendly dyes.

They each have a burn time of around 6-8 hours. They burn cleanly with minimal drip page (as long as they are kept free from drafts!) They have a similar burn time as a beeswax votive.

These are a sweet gift for any chicken-lovers in your life, or as additions to easter baskets! They will be restocked until the end of Summer.

Beeswax burns slowly and brightly, casting a glow that can be quite healing for the body as it is reminiscent of a sunset. It releases a beautiful honey scent as it burns and can help to purify the air unlike candles made with soy or paraffin wax.

Before lighting, be sure the wick is trimmed to around 1/4 inch to promote a clean burn. I recommend burning each candle until the wax pool reaches the edge before blowing it out! This helps it to burn evenly without tunneling.

NOTE: as these are a natural product, some color variation is to be expected!

name: Beeswax Corncob Candle
description:
This candle looks good enough to eat!

Introducing our corncob beeswax candle as part of our Summer Farmer’s Market candle collection!

Each corncob measures approximately 6” tall and has a burn time of 22-25 hours.

The corncobs are crafted with pure beeswax and a lead-free cotton wick!

They would be darling for:

name: Beeswax Morel Mushroom Candles
description:
Darling little morel mushrooms made of beeswax! They comes in a set of 3, two small and one large. They measure approximately 3 inches and 4.5 inches tall.

The are made from 100% pure beeswax with a lead-free cotton wick. They also contain added dyes that are eco-friendly and free from any and all harmful additives and ingredients like phthalates and parabens. Wild Oaks Apothecary approved!

Due to the nature of the dyes and that these are a handmade product, colors may vary from morel to morel.

For best results, burn on a small metal or ceramic plate to catch any drips.

WHY BEESWAX? Beeswax burns slowly and cleanly, without excess soot, and has been said to release negative ions into the air which may help to purify the air. The glow is warm and closely resembles the golden glow from the sunset or sunrise, which is healing for the eyes.

WICK CARE - Trim wick to 1/2 before lighting. For best results, allow to burn for 1-2 hours minimum each time you light it. This helps to avoid tunneling, and helps the mushrooms burn to the edges. Pinch off the excess wick before re-lighting.

BURN TIME - Burn time is approximately 4 hours and 10 hours.

name: Beeswax Pillar Candle
description:
4” Pillar

Approximate burn time is 50 hours for a beautiful, clean-burning pillar that doesn't waste wax! Allow it to burn for 2-3 hours minimum each time you light it.

5.5” Pillar

Approximate burn time is 60 hours for a beautiful, clean-burning pillar that doesn't waste wax! Allow it to burn for 2-3 hours minimum each time you light it.

For best results, allow the candle to burn to the edge each time it burns. This can take up to 4 hours. This ensures that the candle will burn evenly and won’t create a “tunnel” of beeswax.

Trim the wick before each burn. You can trim the wick by pinching off the charred part with your fingers. This ensures your wick won’t burn too fast.

name: Beeswax Votive
description:
These handmade candles are made using cotton, lead-free wicks, and pure beeswax. They smell incredible, burn slowly, and can help to purify the air as they burn. They are the perfect toxin-free candle!

Place the votive in a glass jar before burning. These are meant to melt and fill the jar they are put in.

For best results, allow the candle to burn to the edge each time it burns. This can take up to 4 hours. This ensures that the candle will burn evenly and won’t create a “tunnel” of beeswax.

Trim the wick before each burn. You can trim the wick by pinching off the charred part with your fingers. This ensures your wick won’t burn too fast.

name: Bergamot Elixir
description:
BERGAMOT ELIXIR

Bergamot has some amazing medicinal benefits! It is a highly fragrant flower with high amounts of volatile oils in the plant.

Bergamot (monarda fistulosa) is a member of the mint family. That alone tells us that it can help relieve gassiness, and upset stomachs, and can help to soothe the body overall.

Bergamot has a high thymol content, which is a strong antiseptic also found in the herb Thyme. It can help remedy respiratory tract infections, gas, diarrhea, nausea, whooping cough, cold and flu symptoms, fevers, and wounds.

As an antifungal, bergamot can be used to gently protect the body's microbiome while fighting off fungal infections such as ringworm, athlete's foot, and more. It can be used as a mouth wash to help with toothaches, mouth sores, canker sores, and sore throats. It is a fragrant, potent flower that can be a useful addition to your medicine cabinet. This elixir is paired with raw honey which only adds to the medicinal benefits.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

description:
This tea is crafted with the needs of women in focus, offering a gentle and soothing blend that supplies essential minerals for various phases in life.. name: Blue Vervain Tincture
description:
BLUE VERVAIN TINCTURE

Blue vervain is a VERY bitter herb with VERY potent medicinal qualities!

Blue vervain acts as a nervine, bitter, mild sedative, relaxant, diuretic, and more. Blue vervain is typically recommended for Type A personalities. Those who are. "tight-necked, over-achieving, list-makers, who can’t ask for help.” as Thomas Easley says. It can be used for those who make lists, have a hard time saying no, are strong in words and action, and have trouble sitting still. Blue vervain can help those who have nervous or tension headaches, irritability, muscular tension, inflammation, and insomnia. Blue vervain can also be used for those with anger fits, muscle spasms, PMS symptoms, digestive issues, and tension help specifically in the neck and shoulders. If you hold tension in your neck and shoulders, as I do, then blue vervain is the herb for you!

Blue vervain can be taken before meals to help with digestion. It does NOT taste good, but that is often a sign of how well the herb works and what it can help with! Bitter herbs are often used for sluggish livers and sluggish digestive tracts.

Blue vervain can help with menstrual support. It acts as a hormone balancer to help estrogen and progesterone receptor binding. It can help relieve stress during the menstrual cycle and help those needing some extra lymphatic care.

Blue vervain often works best when taken in very small doses, like 3-5 drops at a time, and is a great remedy for those who can't seem to turn off their brains during times of rest!

name: Boar-Bristle Brush
description:
Made in Germany, this hairbrush is made from Pear wood and boar bristles. It is plastic-free and works as a great hair detangler!

This is also my recommended brush for sheepskins. The bristles work to get the sheepskin nice and fluffy again!

name: Brown Sheepskin Square
description:
ABOUT

17"x17" approximate measurements

These are sheepskin squares, leftover from the tanning process! Sometimes sheepskins are made into rugs and they have scraps left over, or a full sheepskin was damaged in the tanning process so they salvaged the square. These all vary in texture and thickness but are all cream-colored. Some of these have marks on the back from the tanning process or are sewn together if they received cuts during the process. All are amazing quality!

These fit perfectly on a desk chair or a seat in the car, and are also amazing for all the benefits of the sheepskin without the pricetag of a large one. You can place your baby on this, place it atop your pillow at night, travel with it to make a familiar spot for your kids, or use it as a portable seat! The possibilities are endless!

They are soft, they are cozy, AND they have some medicinal benefits. The fuzzy fiber that gives warmth and protection to sheep is actually healing and beneficial to humans as well. Sheepskins can vary in color depending on the breed of sheep. Sheepskin date back to the beginning of time, with clothes or bedding being fashioned from the skins. Sheepskins were once used to collect gold in riverbeds, prevent bedsores, warm hands and feet in winter, and used to wrap babies up to protect them from bitter winter winds. Many cultures have sheepskin as a normal part of their bedding and clothing. With an incredibly high signature frequency of 5,000 (compared to 100 for the human body), wool can work to uplift the body and not add extra stress that synthetic fibers can add to our bodies. When mixed with linen, which actually also has a signature frequency of 5,000, the two fibers can cancel each other out and collapse the energy field. Because of this, it’s best to pick one fiber or the other and try not to mix the two or wear both at the same time for the best benefits.

My babies LOVE “sheepskin naps.” It is a phrase I started to use a few years ago when my daughter was born. She would rest so deeply and peacefully when she napped on a sheepskin, and from that day onward we started traveling with a sheepskin so she could have a sheepskin nap everywhere we went. My son napped on a sheepskin every day that first year of his life! Sheepskins can also be used for patients staying in their bed for many hours at a time, and those that develop bedsores. Sheepskin helps relieve pressure from the pressure points and works to regulate the body’s temperature, making it a cozy and soft thing to lay on. When looking for a sheepskin, get your nose into the fibers and take a big whiff! The sheepskin should feel soft and fuzzy, not dry, and should have a slight sheep-y smell. This is a good sign that the lanolin is still intact! If you can ask, try to find out if the sheepskin has been bleached, which strips the fibers of lanolin and leaves the fur very white but very dry.

When cared for, a sheepskin can last decades and can be passed along to the generations after you. They are a beautiful heirloom gift. These come from Europe and the skins go through a traditional tanning method referred to as "vegetable tanning." The skins are soaked in salt water, then treated with gentle vegetable-and-plant derived substances. They are free from chromium, formaldehyde, eulan, formalin, PCB, optical brighteners, plasticizers, etc. The lanolin is largely preserved in this method, leaving a good amount of medicinal benefits.

DISCLAIMER: These are a natural product and as such will have some imperfections that make them unique. This may include: 

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality. 

  • Stitching along the backside. These are a zero-waste product, and our tannery stitches up to 2 pieces of sheepskin together. They are expertly connected and do not affect the quality!

name: Bumps & Bruises Balm
description:
As the name suggests, this was formulated for bumps and bruises, swelling, and sprained joints.

The herbs were chosen for their known ability to help bring down swelling, reduce the appearance of bruising, and support the body through painful bumps. The balm can be applied to bruising or swelling as needed to help relieve pain, reduce swelling, and support the body as it begins the healing process.

Elderleaf is a lesser-known remedy for bruising and swelling. It was traditionally used to bring down inflammation, support the healing of blood vessels, and help to reduce swelling as the body heals.

Arnica flowers are known for their ability to help bring down swelling and help relieve pain.

Comfrey is a medicinal herb that can often be found growing wild. It is most known for its ability to promote healing after sprains and fractures. Comfrey can be used externally to soothe inflamed joints or injuries. It is best to avoid applying comfrey to wounds that are deep, like puncture wounds, as it can close the wound too quickly without letting the body rid of possible infection. When used in this salve, comfrey acts as an anti-inflammatory agent to calm areas that have been stung, bitten, or have a rash.

Calendula is known as a sunshine flower, supporting skin with antifungal properties, anti-inflammatory properties, and promoting wound healing. It has also traditionally been used to heal scars.

Gotu kola is a leaf traditionally used to support skin healing

Ingredients — Grass-fed house-rendered tallow, organic cold-pressed jojoba oil, organic cold-pressed olive oil, castor oil, extracts from all wildcrafted elder leaf, arnica flowers, comfrey leaf, calendula flowers, gotu kola, and beeswax

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass jar

This soap is gentle enough for use on your hands or body and is a gentle degreaser while also still being moisturizing for your skin. All ingredients are organic or wildcrafted.

name: Cacao and Mushroom Herbal Honey
description:
An electuary is a mixture of herbs and raw honey and is a traditional method to consume herbs with ease. The honey beautifully brings the flavors together and suspends the herbs. Electuaries can be thick enough to roll into a lozenge, or thin enough to pour. This electuary falls somewhere in between! It has a paste texture.

This honey was crafted with a cup of hot cocoa in mind.

Electuraries can be consumed by the spoonful or can be drizzled over yogurt or stirred into a warm beverage. The texture of an electuary is a little gritty, as you are consuming larger amounts of herbs at once, but it delivers the herbs to your body so quickly.

This electuary is cacao-rich with a hint of the earthy mushroom flavors. All mushrooms were pre-extracted for full benefits.

The honey can be used any way you would normally use honey:

  • Drizzled on pancakes

  • On biscuits with a little butter

  • In cookies or protein bites

  • To sweeten teas

  • As a garnish for a charcuterie board

  • As a dip for fruits like apples or bananas

  • Stirred in to a mug of steamed milk

Serving suggestion is 1 teaspoon (7g) as desired.

Ingredients — Raw honey, organic, raw cacao powder, all wildcrafted or wood grown reishi fruiting body (ganoderma lucidum),* cordyceps fruiting body (cordyceps militaris),* maitake fruiting body (grifola frondosa),* chaga fruiting body (inonotus obliquus),* lion’s mane fruiting body (hericium erinaceus), turkey tail fruiting body (trametes versicolor), vanilla bean (vanilla planifolia)

*heated for full benefits

comes in a 6 oz clear glass jar

name: Calendula Tincture
description:
Calendula is a sunny flower that boasts many medicinal benefits for both internal use and external use. For wounds, it can help to expedite healing and prevent infections. It is seen as an antifungal and a styptic, helping to stop the flow of blood in wounds.

For internal use, calendula is anti-inflammatory, astringent, lends lymphatic support, and can also be used to help with digestion. It can be used to help heal the gut.

Calendula contains resins within the fresh flowers, so this tincture was prepared with the fresh herbs. Calendula can help support the body through transitions, gut ailments, digestive issues, ulcers, chronic infections, and lymph support.

name: California Poppy Tincture
description:
An ode to my home state, this beautiful flower offers intense support for a body in pain.

California poppy contains alkaloids with mild sedative effects. It can be used to help promote sleep, soothe the body, calm frazzled nerves, calm big emotions in children, relax muscles,  and can help with tension headaches and migraines.

The body receives it in a similar way that it receives opiates but in a much more mild and non-narcotic way. It was also once prescribed to help with children who wet the bed, and those struggling with PTSD or addictions.

California poppy was once likened to morphine but without the harsh side effects or addictive qualities.

It is a powerful pain reliever and nerve support and is considered to be gentle enough for use by all ages.

description:

name: Calming Mist
description:
Hydrosols are steam-distilled plant extracts. They contain the water-soluble constituents of the plant.

Together, these plants and flowers work to gently provide a calming, soothing scent. When made into a fresh hydrosol, those compounds transfer over and may offer deep hydration support, a calming effect, and wound-healing support.

LAVENDER — Lavender is known to promote calm, support inflamed skin, and soothe cuts and burns.

MARSHMALLOW — Marshmallow is a slippery root rich in mucilage.

CHAMOMILE — Chamomile is known for its calming effect on skin, and its gentle, spicy, and earthy scent.

Together, these plants and flowers work to gently hydrate the skin.

To use, spritz on skin liberally as needed.

This comes in a 2-ounce amber glass spray bottle

name: Catnip Elixir
description:
Nepeta Cataria

ABOUT: 

More famously known for its ability to attract cats and make them happy and act drunk, catnip is actually an incredible, versatile medicinal herb that belongs in every herbal arsenal. 

Catnip belongs to the mint family. In ancient times, catnip was praised for its ability to help chest congestion, loosen phlegm, ease colicky babies, relieve gassiness, help relieve diarrhea, especially in children, and much more. For colds and coughs, catnip can be used as needed to calm spasms in the lungs. It can be used as a way to promote a productive fever, letting the body do its thing while offering support. 

For all things relating to the nervous system, catnip will be your friend. Panic attacks can be alleviated by holding the catnip tincture in your mouth for 30-60 seconds, allowing it to reach the bloodstream and activate its calming properties. Nervous headaches can be counteracted by consuming catnip tea or tincture, letting it act as a nervine to relax the body. 

Digestive complaints, rooted in nervousness, can be supported with this herb. 

Fevers, aches, pains, tension headaches, panic attacks, coughs, colds, fevers, chest congestion, colicky babies, and diarrhea are all things that this versatile herb can help with. Honey adds a touch of sweetness and medicinal benefits. 

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

While catnip is in the mint family, some say it can be a uterine tonic and encourage cramping. You can do your research to see if you are comfortable using this herb. No studies have proven it to be dangerous for breastfeeding or pregnancy.

ACTIONS: 

Nervine

Diophoretic

Anti-spasmodic

Carminative

Sedative

Emmenagogue

Diuretic 

DOSAGE: 

You can try 1-3ml, 3x a day or as needed.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Chaga Elixir
description:
Chaga is a beautiful mushroom that offers immune support. It is a slow-growing mushroom that grows out of wounds from trees and can take years before the mushroom makes its appearance on the outside of the tree. Because of its slow growth, it can be harvested unethically. This Chaga was harvested ethically.

It was processed using a triple-extract recipe that yields a potent end result, extracting in alcohol and heat and water. The method is from Arielle de Martinez, used with permission.

Chaga can help to regulate the immune system. For an underactive one, it will give it a boost, and it will help to calm an overactive immune system.

It can be used to help with c@ncer, and tümors, and to also counter some of the stress from conventional cancer treatments like chemo and radiation. Chaga can help to support the stomach and intestines and soothe irritations such as ulcers and IBS. It can also help with relaxing the body and bringing about a grounding calm.

name: Chamomile Glycerite
description:

It may provide support for teething babies and toddlers experiencing discomfort and pain. It can also help to calm big emotions in littles by relaxing the body and offering mild sedative effects. It can be used to help support restlessness and irritability.

For aches and pains, those that cause restlessness from the discomfort, chamomile may help to relax the body and help relieve the pain.

This was made with spring water, non-GMO palm-derived glycerin, and the fresh herb.

name: Cleavers Tincture
description:
Cleavers were once used to treat c@nc3r, and was used as a remedy for venomous bites. Cleavers can help promote urine flow, which is useful for those with kidney or bladder complaints.

It can be used by those with bladder and kidney inflammation, those with enlarged lymph nodes,  and those with dry skin or psoriasis.

For lymphatic support, cleavers work to promote circulation. It is a beautiful herbal ally to have on hand.

DOSAGE

1-3 dropperfuls, 3x a day. For infections or sickness, you can try taking a higher dosage as needed. 

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Clementine Candle
description:
These darling candles are my ode to a California winter! It is citrus season right now, with the trees bursting with juicy fruits.

This clementine candle measures approximately 2” wide by 1.75” tall. Burn time is approximately 15 hours.

Made from 100% beeswax with eco-friendly, non-toxic dyes.

*Please note these come with a little green beeswax leaf! That leaf may shift during shipping but can be reattached as needed with a bit of heat from your hand and some pressure!

They have a dusty orange color, not as vibrant as the real deal!

name: Coconut Bottle Brush
description:
This scrub brush is useful for cleaning the insides of jars and cups. 

it is made of coconut wood with coconut bristles and is sturdy and scrubs without scratching surfaces. It can fit inside most wide-mouth jars and even a chemex.

It measures approximately 10" long.

name: Copper Sponges
description:
Made from copper, these scrubbies can be used to get stubborn food off of pots and pans.

They are long-lasting and are non-toxic, making it the perfect addition to your kitchen.

Copper can scrub off food and also can help get those tough, sticky labels off of jars. It does not scratch glass, and can be used on most metal pans without scratching them, as it is a softer metal. But always do a spot test first!

name: Cordyceps Elixir
description:
CORDYCEPS

Cordyceps sinensis

This elixir is made with permission using Arielle de Martinez's method (Her website is here). Her method utilizes alcohol, heat, and water to extract all the beneficial constituents from cordyceps. A mushroom supplement should be heated to release all the beneficial polysaccharides.

This elixir contains alcohol, Mount Shasta spring water, raw honey, and non-GMO, food-grade, palm-derived glycerin. The honey adds a touch of sweetness and medicinal qualities, and the small amount of glycerin helps to suspend cordyceps so each dose is balanced. The alcohol is necessary for one of the extraction parts, but in the final dose, it is a balanced amount of alcohol, water, honey, and glycerin.

ABOUT

Arguably the superfood of all mushrooms, cordyceps are packed with immune-supporting and power-packed constituents. Cordyceps contain high amounts of beta-glucans and polysaccharides. Dr. Richard Allen Miller says, “Polysaccharides are long sugar chains with many oxygen sections within them. As these sugars are broken down by the body, the oxygen molecules are released and absorbed on a cellular level….This mushroom is extremely high in oxygen molecules.”

Here are a few of the ways that cordyceps can support the body:

ANTIBIOTICS — Within the mushroom, it contains an antibiotic called “Cordyceptin.” This antibiotic is extremely effective against bacteria that are otherwise antibiotic-resistant. Cordyceps has been shown in studies to act as an antibiotic while still maintaining the health of the body.

RESPIRATORY — Since cordyceps helps to provide oxygen to the body, it can also support respiratory health. Those with asthma, bronchitis infections, tuberculosis, and coughs can be supported with cordyceps.

HORMONES — In studies, cordyceps increased healthy hormone levels and supported the endocrine system.

ATHLETIC STAMINA — Cordyceps can increase physical stamina and has been shown to do that in several studies! In 1993, a group of 9 women were taking cordyceps and then shattered 9 world records, by a LOT. The Olympic committee finally ruled that cordyceps were allowed to be taken by all athletes.

CHOLESTEROL — Studies have shown that cordyceps can help the body maintain a healthy level of cholesterol. Studies showed that cordyceps lowered total cholesterol by 10-21%, and triglycerides by 9 to 26%. It simultaneously increased HDL by 27-30% (the good cholesterol!)

LIVER — Cordyceps can help improve liver conditions such as hepatitis.

HEART HEALTH — Cordyceps has been shown to calm irregular heartbeats. Cordyceps were administered to mice and showed that mice had a 400% increase in their survival rate.

TUMORS — Studies were conducted in China and Japan using a dose of 6 grams per day. Dr. Richard Allen Miller says, “In conjunction with chemotherapy, tumors reduced in size in 46% of patients….White blood cell counts were maintained and tumor size was significantly reduced in about half of the patients.”

IMMUNE — It can increase muscle mass and increase the building of healthy cells. It can help to recharge the body’s ability to fight infections and tumors.

FATIGUE — A dose of 3 grams of cordyceps a day was shown to dramatically reduce fatigue in elderly patients. It also helps to increase cellular production and oxygen supply in the body.

REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH — It has been shown to improve libido in both men and women and help to come against fertility and the struggles that come along with that. Infertile sperm count improved by 300% after taking cordyceps.

And I could seriously go on and on about cordyceps! What CAN’T it do, truly.

Major credit goes to Dr. Richard Allen Miller for his compilation of the amazing benefits of forceps, found in his book “Power Tools for the 21st Century” found here on his website.

name: Cork Lids Set of Four
description: New to the shop! Available in wide-mouth or regular mouth. I use these lids for my home apothecary to store my herbs. They are also great for dried goods or snacks!

name: Corriedale Roving Wool, bulk
description:
Corriedale wool is a favorite around the world for its softness and strength. It is great for needle felting, wet felting, and spinning. The Corriedale sheep is a cross between the Merino and Lincoln breeds. This special cross produces a thick, strong wool fiber that is also very soft.

Staple length of 90 mm (3.5 inches)

29.5 micron

8 ounces of Corriedale wool top.

Processed with environmentally safe methods. Ethically sourced and cruelty free! This wool is sourced from farmers in Australia who adhere to strict animal welfare regulations, including being mulesing-free.

Each color ships with a plain white gift box, size 5x5x5 inches.

name: Cranberry Elderberry Tonic
description:
This tasty tonic is a good source of vitamins C, A, K, iron, calcium, magnesium, folate, potassium, zinc, and manganese. It can help replenish needed nutrients and may offer your daily dose of vitamins and minerals.

An oxymel is a combination of an acid and honey and is a potent way to extract vitamins and minerals and help the body retain hydration. It can be taken as digestive support before or after meals and as a delicious addition to your daily beverages.

INGREDIENTS
Raw apple cider vinegar, fresh elderberries, fresh cranberries, fresh orange peel, fresh orange, rose hips,* frankincense resin (boswellia carterii), raw honey

*dried

name: Digestive Bitters
description:
This is a collaboration with my friend Nicole from Dancing Fern Folk Apothecary. I asked her if she could formulate a seasonal bitters blend with herbs that resonated with her. I offered a suggestion (added dual-extracted reish!) and then processed the bitters in our shop! She came up with this beautiful blend of herbs and spices to support the body’s digestive tract.

Our American diet is severely lacking in bitter foods that are more common in other cultures! Bitters help signal to the liver to start preparing to digest food. Bitters can be taken before each meal to encourage and support healthy digestion, and help to ease stomachaches, gassy stomachs, or those having trouble with bloating after a meal.

To take, spray 1-3 sprays on your tongue and allow your mouth to fully taste the flavor. It is a pleasant bitter, with strong notes of cardamom and orange coming through.

Ingredients — Wood-grown wildcrafted Reishi (dual-extracted), organic cardamom, organic orange peel, organic ginger, wildcrafted fresh burdock root, wildcrafted fresh yarrow, spring water, 100-proof vodka, brandy

name: Drawing Salve
description:
NEW FORMULA with plantain added!

This salve is a must-have for any first aid kit! This salve is smooth yet slightly sticky. Apply to bug bites, splinters, and more, and cover with a bandage. Leave the salve on for a few hours or up to 12 hours, then gently remove it with a wet washcloth. Avoid getting on clothing as this salve can stain due to the charcoal. With activated charcoal and bentonite clay working together, this drawing salve is incredible for lifting things out of your skin. Think poison from bug bites, splinters, rashes, infections, and ingrown toenails. It can also be used as a spot treatment on the face for acne.

ABOUT THE INGREDIENTS:

Comfrey (symphytum officinalis) is a medicinal herb that can often be found growing wild. It is most known for its ability to promote healing after sprains and fractures. Comfrey can be used externally to soothe inflamed joints or injuries. It is best to avoid applying comfrey to wounds that are deep, like puncture wounds, as it can close the wound too quickly without letting the body rid itself of possible infection. When used in this salve, comfrey acts as an anti-inflammatory agent to calm areas that have been stung, bitten, or have a rash.

Echinacea root (E.angustifolia) was traditionally used by Native Americans to treat snakebites and infections. It can act like an herbal antibiotic and help to prevent infections.

Plantain (plantago major) is known for its soothing properties and ability to help draw impurities and foreign objects out of the skin.

Activated charcoal is a powerful ingredient that binds to things like poison and pulls it out of your system. It can be taken internally to remedy food poisoning or used externally, like in this salve.

Bentonite clay is known for its ability to pull toxins like heavy metals from substances. While it can commonly be found as an ingredient in face masks, when used in a salve, it dries and tightens, binding to and pulling out foreign objects like a bee sting or splinter.

Ingredients — Organic cold-pressed jojoba oil, all wildcrafted comfrey leaf, echinacea root, and plantain leaf, bentonite clay, activated charcoal, beeswax

Comes in a 1-ounce amber glass jar OR a lip balm tube for easy, on-the-go application.

name: Echinacea Tincture
description:
Echinacea purpurea

ABOUT

Echinacea was once used to treat toothaches and gum disease due to its analgesic properties. Also referred to as ‘Snakeroot’ amongst many tribes, it was used to help remedy snakebites and scorpion stings. It can be called, ‘Nature’s Antibiotic’ and reached for whenever an antibiotic would normally be needed. 

It can activate the immune system, so it is best taken at the first sign of sickness, helping the body to rid itself of infections. It can stimulate an immune response and can raise white blood counts. If taken in the middle of sickness, the body might become extra tired because it has already been working hard to combat whatever virus your body has. It can be especially helpful for upper respiratory tract infections. 

This tincture was crafted with fresh roots. It tingles on the tongue and has a smooth taste going down. 

There are countless articles on the benefits of echinacea! Some can be found here: 

This is a perfect staple to include in your wellness cabinet!

CONTRAINDICATIONS

Some have had concerns with people with autoimmune diseases taking echinacea as it might tire out the body. I would suggest learning about echinacea and doing your research to see if it is a good fit for your body. 

ACTIONS

Analgesic

Antimicrobial

Antiviral

Anti-inflammatory

Anticatarrhal

Vulnerary

Alternative

DOSAGE

1-3 dropperfuls, 3x a day. For infections or sickness, you can try taking a higher dosage as needed. 

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Elderberry Elixir
description:
ELDERBERRY

Sambucus nigra

ABOUT: 

Elderberry has traditionally been used to help with colds, fevers, and the flu. It works to help activate the immune system, allowing the body to fight off ailments.  Elderberry has been shown to help shorten the length of sickness when taken at the beginning of feeling sick. 

It contains flavonoids that stimulate the immune system. Flavonoids help to block viruses from attaching to host cells in the body. Elderberry can also help increase urine flow, bring down fevers, and gently purify the blood. The addition of honey can help provide medicinal benefits, soothe sore throats, and improve the flavor of the tincture.

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

Elderberry is considered safe to be used by babies, pregnant women, nursing women, and all ages. Those with autoimmune diseases might want to start with a drop or two and see how their body feels, before trying larger doses. As always, do your research and feel confident in knowing that herbs are beautiful tools. 

ACTIONS: 

Alterative

Antiviral

Decongestant

Diuretic

Febrifuge

DOSAGE: 

You can try 1-3ml, 2-3x a day, or as needed throughout the entire course of sickness.

name: Elderflower Tincture
description:
Sambucus nigra

ABOUT: 

The floral, sunshine part of elderberry, Elderflower can be used in many ways to help the body’s immune system. 

It can be used to help bring up mucus when dealing with coughs or congestion and can help bronchitis and other upper respiratory tract infections. 

It can be used to treat colds and the flu. Elderflower can also be used to induce sweating which can help bring down high fevers or support the body in fighting off infections. 

The flowers can act as a gentle laxative when needed. The tincture can also be used as a mouthwash or rinse for oral inflammation or gum issues. 

You can reach for this tincture when your body needs a little support combatting a viral infection. 

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

None known.

DOSAGE: 

You can try 2-4ml, 2-3x a day.

name: Emerge - Herbal Tea
description:
Formerly Winter to Spring Tonic

This tea blend was created to help the body adjust from the seasonal changes. Moving from winter, a time of cocooning, to spring, a time of sunshine and new life, can be beautiful and also challenging for our bodies at times. This tea blend may help to support sluggish digestive tracts, support the body’s mineral levels, and help to gently support the liver.

Enjoy this tea on a daily basis or as needed.

We recommend savoring a cup during moments of solitude to allow your body to relax and mindfully enjoy each sip.

INGREDIENTS: (all organic or wildcrafted)

Nettles - are rich in iron, calcium, magnesium, protein and other nutrients. Nettles are anti-inflammatory and have anti-allergenic properties which help support the body with the spring blooms.

Butterfly Pea Flowers - are rich in antioxidants which can help alleviate inflammation in the body. It is used to enhance memory, anti-stress and adds a beautiful blue hue to the tea.

Rosehips - are rich in vitamin c and are uplifting and good for reducing the impact of stress on the body.

Dandelion Root - is used to aid the liver and stimulate bile flow, beneficial to the microflora of the gut in overall support for the body moving into Spring.

Orange Peel - is aromatic and bitter, stimulating appetite and digestion.

Each jar contains 8-10 servings, depending on how strong you like your tea!

name: Evergreen Candle
description:
Our herb-infused tallow candles were the first on the market, utilizing scents from herbs and spices without using essential oils.

Our evergreen tallow and beeswax candle is a proprietary blend of herbs and resins. The ingredients are slowly infused with the tallow and beeswax to produce a yummy finished product!

They will not fill the room quite like a store-bought candles will, but they have a warm scent and are totally non-toxic.

SCENT PROFILE - This candle has a gentle and uplifting scent, with hints of rosemary and mint and cozy resins! It was designed to smell kind of like a walk in a forest.

CANDLE CARE - For best results, allow the candle to burn to the edge each time it burns. This can take up to 4 hours. This ensures that the candle will burn evenly and won’t create a “tunnel” of beeswax.

Trim the wick before each burn. You can trim the wick by pinching off the charred part with your fingers. This ensures your wick won’t burn too fast.

The candle comes in an 8-ounce amber glass jar with a lid.

name: Extra Small Cream Sheepskin
description:
ABOUT

They measure approximately 33"-38” long and 23"-28” wide but may vary from sheepskin to sheepskin as this is a natural product and can’t be mass produced in the same exact size each time  

The “blueprint” of the leather will remain about the same, usually 33”-35” in length, but the fur will make the sheepskin appear longer! 

The size varies and they might be a couple of inches smaller or larger. The fur ranges from 2" thick to 3" long, but some may have slightly longer fur depending on the batch from our tannery. Each sheepskin will vary in their shade of cream, ranging from a darker cream to a lighter one. The texture also varies. This is a good sign as the sheepskins are not bleached!

They are soft, they are cozy, AND they have some medicinal benefits. The fuzzy fiber that gives warmth and protection to sheep is actually healing and beneficial to humans as well.

Sheepskins date back to the beginning of time, with clothes or bedding being fashioned from the skins. Sheepskins were once used to collect gold in riverbeds, prevent bedsores, warm hands and feet in winter, and used to wrap babies up to protect them from bitter winter winds. Many cultures have sheepskin as a normal part of their bedding and clothing. With an incredibly high signature frequency of 5,000 (compared to 100 for the human body), wool can work to uplift the body and not add extra stress that synthetic fibers can add to our bodies. When mixed with linen, which actually also has a signature frequency of 5,000, the two fibers can cancel each other out and collapse the energy field. Because of this, it’s best to pick one fiber or the other and try not to mix the two or wear both at the same time for the best benefits.

My babies LOVE “sheepskin naps.” It is a phrase I started to use a few years ago when my daughter was born. She would rest so deeply and peacefully when she napped on a sheepskin, and from that day onward we started traveling with a sheepskin so she could have a sheepskin nap everywhere we went. My son has napped on a sheepskin every day of his life! Sheepskins can also be used for patients staying in their bed for many hours at a time, and those that develop bedsores. Sheepskin helps relieve pressure from the pressure points and works to regulate the body’s temperature, making it a cozy and soft thing to lay on. When looking for a sheepskin, get your nose into the fibers and take a big whiff! The sheepskin should feel soft and fuzzy, not dry, and should have a slight sheep-y smell. This is a good sign that the lanolin is still intact! If you can ask, try to find out if the sheepskin has been bleached, which strips the fibers of lanolin and leaves the fur very white but very dry.

When cared for, a sheepskin can last decades and can be passed along to the generations after you. They are a beautiful heirloom gift. These come from Europe and the skins go through a traditional tanning method referred to as "vegetable tanning." The skins are soaked in salt water, then treated with gentle vegetable-and-plant derived substances. They are free from chromium, formaldehyde, eulan, formalin, PCB, optical brighteners, plasticizers, etc. The lanolin is largely preserved in this method, leaving a good amount of medicinal benefits.

DISCLAIMER: These are a natural product and as such will have some imperfections that make them unique. This may include: 

  • “armpits” which are on four corners of the sheepskin. Sheep naturally don’t grow fur there so they may appear to be bald patches! 

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality.

name: Facial Mist
description:
Hydrosols are steam-distilled plant extracts. They contain the water-soluble constituents of the plant.

When made into a fresh hydrosol, those compounds transfer over and may offer deep hydration support, a calming effect, and wound-healing support.

MARSHMALLOW — Marshmallow is a slippery root rich in mucilage.

ROSE — Roses are synonymous with love and with gardens. They have been used for centuries in skincare and supplements to support the body inside and out. Roses are rich in vitamin c which might promote collagen production and help to promote healthy, glowing skin. The scent is uplifting and calming.

Together, these plants and flowers work to gently hydrate the skin.

To use, spritz on skin liberally as needed.

This comes in a 2-ounce amber glass spray bottle

name: Fern Pillar Beeswax Candle
description:
This beautiful fern candle is almost too pretty to burn. It is made from 100% pure beeswax with a rich honey scent, and a cotton lead-free wick.

This comes in three options:

  • Plain beeswax

  • Forest green (a shade of deep green. Due to the dye and that this is a handmade product, variations in color shades may occur from candle to candle)

  • Cranberry (a beautiful shade of deep red. Due to the dye and that this is a handmade product, variations in color shades may occur from candle to candle)

  • Peppercorn (our new black color for our candles)

  • Chestnut (a deep cinnamon reddish brown)

  • Avocado (a charteuse green)

The fern green candle has added dyes that are eco-friendly and free from any and all harmful additives and ingredients like phthalates and parabens. Wild Oaks Apothecary approved!

This candle weighs a whopping 16 ounces, an entire pound of beeswax! They make for cute centerpieces, fireplace mantle decor, or countertop decor, and would be a fun addition to your Thanksgiving tablescape. It measures approximately 6” tall and 2.5” across  

WHY BEESWAX? Beeswax burns slowly and cleanly, without excess soot, and has been said to release negative ions into the air which may help to purify the air. The glow is warm and closely resembles the golden glow from the sunset or sunrise, which is healing for the eyes.

WICK CARE - Trim wick to 1/2 before lighting. For best results, allow to burn for 4 hours minimum each time you light it. This helps to avoid tunneling, and helps the pillar burn to the edges. Pinch off the excess wick before re-lighting.

BURN TIME - Burn time is approximately 60 hours hours depending on maintenance. This is a slow burning candle and also doubles as an emergency candle due to the burn time and sturdiness of the pillar!

name: Feverfew Tincture
description:
Feverfew is commonly known for its ability to help with migraines and headaches, especially those relieved by heat. It has been shown in many studies to greatly reduce pain for those with chronic migraines. It can be used to help support painful or irregular menstrual cycles and may be used postpartum to help support toning the uterus. Feverfew can be used when there is “stuck heat” in the body, like with inflammation, arthritis, and more. It has also been known to support ear infections and earaches and can help induce perspiration to help reduce fevers and move heat from the body.

name: First-Aid Ointment
description:
(previously known as “Remedy”)

Formulated to be an all-purpose first-aid companion, this ointment is crafted from herbs and resins that are perfect for your wellness kit.

The herbs and resins work together to support deep healing for wounds, cuts, and scrapes, and may provide relief for rashes and bug bites. The herbs are known for their ability to help prevent infections and stop bleeding quickly, and frankincense resin is a bandage that can help support wound healing. This ointment is a perfect replacement for name-brand antibiotic creams and goes on easily.

Yarrow is known for its ability to stop bleeding and to prevent gram-positive bacteria from growing.

Plantain is known for its drawing ability and soothing properties that aid in healing the skin.

Frankincense resin is the lifeblood of the frankincense tree, produced as needed to heal the tree. When used on wounds, it quickly provides soothing relief and antibacterial support.

Echinacea root has been traditionally used to prevent infections and speed up healing.

Calendula is known as a sunshine flower, supporting skin with antifungal properties, anti-inflammatory properties, and promoting wound healing. It has also traditionally been used to heal scars.

Ingredients — Organic cold-pressed olive oil and beeswax infused with extracts from all wildcrafted yarrow, plantain leaf, frankincense resin, echinacea root, and calendula flowers

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass jar.

name: Focus Blend
description:
This blend was crafted to support the brain. The herbs in this blend have been traditionally used to support the brain, healthy blood circulation, focus, mental clarity, energy levels, the cardiovascular system, and more. Lion’s Mane is a well-studied mushroom has been shown to be supportive of the brain and enhancing memory. This blend may be used to help the brain stay alert, support clear thinking, strengthen blood vessels, and support the body through times of feeling brain fog.

Ingredients — Wildcrafted fresh extracts of rosemary (rosemarinus officinale), and ginkgo (ginkgo biloba), wildcrafted cordyceps fruiting body* (cordyceps militaris)* and lion’s mane (hericium erinaceus),* grain alcohol, spring water, non-GMO palm-derived glycerin, raw honey *heated for full benefits

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass dropper bottle

name: Fourth Trimester Blend
description:
This blend was crafted with the tender postpartum season in mind. During a time when the body experiences a rush of hormonal shifts and adjustments, extra support may be needed. These herbs work together to support hormonal health, cardiovascular health, and emotional health. They may help with mood swings, cramping after birth, uterine health, burnout, exhaustion, PTSD, and more. It may also support the heart, emotionally, and encourage a lion-hearted bravery when facing hard moments.

Note: Shake before using to disperse the latex.

Ingredients — Wildcrafted fresh aerial parts of motherwort (leonurus cardiaca), milky oats (avena sativa), 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol, spring water), raw honey

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass dropper bottle

name: Garlic-Mullein Ear Oil
description:
NEW, updated formula!

This potent oil may be used to help support earaches, ear infections, and other internal ear pain.

Garlic is known for its anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial support, offering relief for aches and pains.

Mullein flowers are known for their anti-inflammatory properties, helping to relieve inflammation while also easing pain.

St. John’s Wort flowers are only potent when used fresh, and contain a pain-relieving compound that helps to soothe irritations and reduce inflammation and pain.

It is best used when warm. You can warm the bottle in your shirt for 5 minutes, then apply 3-5 drops of oil to the infected ear. Let it sit for 15 minutes before tipping the oil out onto a cotton ball or cloth. Repeat as needed every few hours.

Ingredients — Organic, cold pressed olive oil, fresh St. John’s Wort infused organic olive oil, organic garlic, organic mullein flowers

Comes in a 1-ounce amber dropper bottle.

name: Ginger Root Elixir
description:
ABOUT: 

Ginger is a warming and stimulating root that has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for centuries. It prefers the digestive tract and may support healthy digestion, ease all forms of nausea and motion sickness, support gassy colic, and provide support during menstruation by promoting a healthy flow and offering relief for cramps. It may help warm the body from its core and support healthy circulation which may also help the brain work through ‘stuck’ thought patterns. Ginger may also ease joint discomfort, promote respiratory wellness, and help maintain a balanced inflammatory response. Ginger is know to be warming and drying and offers warmth to the womb, stomach, extremities, mind, and body overall.

ACTIONS: 

anti-inflammatory

antiemetic

antispasmodic

analgesic

anodyne

carminative

circulatory stimulant

diaphoretic

digestive aid

emmenagogue

DOSAGE: 

You can try taking 2-3 droppers full, 2x a day as needed.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

description:
Ginkgo Biloba

ABOUT: 

Gingko is a leaf that lends itself to supporting the systems of the body. The Gingko tree has been known to live as long as a thousand years, which is telling of how the herb supports the body. As a cognitive support, gingko may help to increase blood flow to the brain, improve memory, support those with dementia and Alzheimer’s disease, and may help to prevent strokes and other clot-related diseases. Gingko may also help with tinnitus and vertigo. It has also been used to support those with altitude sickness, depression, anxiety, eye diseases, and other symptoms that show up in the head.

name: Goat Milk And Sea Salt Soap
description:
This is a creamy bar with a gentle lather and rich, moisturizing ingredients!

These bars are crafted from organic ingredients. The tallow is combined with the other ingredients to make a dreamy bar of soap. This soap is gentle enough for use on your hands or body and is a gentle degreaser. All ingredients are organic or wildcrafted.

Each bar measures roughly 2" by 3" by 1" (NEW SIZE!) and is approximately 4 ounces by weight

GOAT MILK AND SEA SALT SOAP —

  • coconut oil

  • powdered goat milk

  • sea salt

  • lye (sodium hydroxide)

  • water

NOTE: Sea salt can be drying if used on the skin daily! We recommend using it as a hand soap, or following up with a serum or tallow balm if using it as a daily body soap!

name: Goldenrod Elixir
description:
Solidago Canadensis, S. Virgaurea

ABOUT:
Goldenrod is often blamed for seasonal allergies, when in reality, its bright yellow blooms can be helped to counteract seasonal allergies and even animal allergies. It can help thin the mucus and stimulate the body to bring it up and out. After taking a dose of goldenrod, you might notice the urge to sneeze or cough or use the restroom, as it signals to your body to start cleansing where it needs it the most. 

It is well-known for its ability to cleanse the urinary tract and also help the body pass kidney stones. As a diuretic, it increases the frequency of urine, cleansing the body as it flushes out the urinary tract. As a kidney tonic, it can help cleanse the blood through the kidneys. 

Goldenrod can be used to help digestive issues such as gas, stomach pains, and diarrhea. Its bitter taste can help stimulate the flow of bile, preparing the body to digest food when taken half an hour before a meal. 

Goldenrod can be taken for respiratory issues, bronchitis, sinus infections, and colds. It can help the body push stuck mucus up and out of the body. When gargled, it can also help relieve inflammation in the throat. It is incredible at cleansing the body of the remnants of sickness when also taken after the illness has passed.

It has a strong, slightly bitter flavor that is reminiscent of anise or resin. 

CONTRAINDICATIONS:

For those with kidney problems, be sure to keep your hydration high as the goldenrod flushes fluids from your system. 

ACTIONS:

Anti-inflammatory

Antispasmodic

Bitter

Astringent

Diuretic

Diaphoretic


DOSAGE:

You can try 1-3ml, 2-3 times a day or as needed.

INGREDIENTS:

100-proof vodka

WIldcrafted fresh goldenrod blooms

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb
