name: Hair Serum
description:
This is a nourishing oil formulated to offer scalp and hair support, promote shiny hair, and promote hair growth.

ROSEMARY — This herb has been used for centuries and is a special part of many belief systems. It was used in Greece by students who braided it into their hair to help them study. During the Renaissance period, rosemary was used by herbalists for their patients and it was also used by the French for many ailments. It was also considered to be a symbol of Christ, as it was supposed to only grow to the age of 33 years and never grow taller, only wider. It boasts anti-inflammatory and antioxidant benefits. Rosemary can help to stimulate hair growth by improving circulation to the scalp. It has been shown in many studies to encourage hair growth in people of all ages. It is also a gentle support for headaches, helping to relieve tension. It can promote scalp health along with its other benefits!

PEPPERMINT — This herb is well-known for its strong and fresh scent. Peppermint is an invasive plant that can help with a wide variety of ailments when taken internally, and when used externally it can help to relieve rashes, provide a cooling effect, and help to soothe itchy skin. It can help to revitalize the scalp and promote healthy skin, which is important for hair growth. In one study it has been shown to increase dermal thickness, follicle number, and follicle depth when applied topically on the scalp. That study (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4289931/) used peppermint essential oil which is a strong, highly isolated portion of the plant. In this hair oil, whole peppermint is utilized which yields a more potent, balanced version of the plant.

NETTLE LEAF — This stinging plant is rich in vitamins and minerals. Like peppermint and rosemary, stinging nettles can help to boost circulation when applied topically. Nettles contain antioxidants which can help encourage hair growth. It is an astringent that can help to gently cleanse the scalp and contains acids and fatty acids that can nourish the hair follicles and promote shiny hair. Nettle can also help to promote a healthy scalp. The vitamins and minerals found in nettles can help to coat the hair strands and promote healthy, shiny hair.

CALENDULA — A beautiful orange flower in the sunflower family, calendula is a powerful herb for skin support when used topically. Calendula can help to quickly heal wounds, soothe skin with its anti-inflammatory properties, and can help to promote a healthy scalp which is important for hair growth. Calendula can help promote follicle growth and can protect the hair strands as they grow.

Together, these plants and flowers work to gently stimulate the scalp, encourage circulation, and promote hair growth. Apply to the scalp and massage in for a few minutes to promote healthy circulation.

Ingredients - Organic jojoba oil, all wildcrafted or organic extracts of rosemary (salvia rosmarinus), calendula (calendula officinalis), peppermint (mentha x piperita), nettle (urtica dioica)

comes in a 1.4 oz amber glass serum bottle with a dropper

name: Hair and Scalp Mist
description:

To use, spritz on damp hair right at the scalp or apply throughout the day. Gently massage into the scalp! Pair with our scalp oil for extra love.

This comes in a 2-ounce amber glass spray bottle

name: Hand-Dipped Beeswax Tapers
description:
All sizes and colors come as a set of two!

These handmade candles are made using cotton, lead-free wicks, and pure beeswax. They smell incredible, burn slowly, and can help to purify the air as they burn. They are the perfect toxin-free candle!

When cared for, these tapers should be nearly dripless. Take care to keep the wick trimmed before each light, and keep away from drafts or spaces where people walk by often.

The burn time is approximately 1 hour per inch. So for the 9” tapers, the burn time is around 9.5 hours. For the 6” tapers, the burn time is approximately 5.5 hours.

Trim the wick before each burn. You can trim the wick by pinching off the charred part with your fingers. This ensures your wick won’t burn too fast.

name: Hand-rolled Beeswax Candle
description:
NOTE: we updated our size to reflect our original rolled beeswax candles! They burn evenly and have less waste around the edges! They may look skinnier (and they are!) but they will burn more evenly, giving you less wax waste! 

This rustic pillar candle is made from sheets of honeycomb-patterned beeswax . It is made from 100% pure beeswax with a rich honey scent, and a cotton lead-free wick. They smell incredible, burn slowly, and can help to purify the air as they burn. They are the perfect toxin-free candle!

They are approximately 3" and 5" tall and approximately 2.5" across.

For best results, burn on a metal or ceramic plate to catch any potential drips.

WHY BEESWAX? Beeswax burns slowly and cleanly, without excess soot, and has been said to release negative ions into the air which may help to purify the air. The glow is warm and closely resembles the golden glow from the sunset or sunrise, which is healing for the eyes.

WICK CARE - Trim wick to 1/2 before lighting. For best results, allow to burn for 4 hours minimum each time you light it. This helps to avoid tunneling, and helps the pillar burn to the edges. Pinch off the excess wick before re-lighting.

BURN TIME - Burn time is approximately 20-30 hours depending on size and maintenance. It's recommended to burn these on a small metal plate or ceramic dish.

name: Harvest Tea
description:
AUTUMNAL TEA

Another yummy blend from Nicole at Dancing Fern Folk Apothecary! I asked her to create some cozy autumn drinks and she came through!

This tea comes in an amber jar and has 1 ounce of drink mix in it, which is enough for around 16-18 servings servings depending on how strong you like your tea

The mixture contains lemon balm, hawthorn leaves and berries, dried apple, orange peel, cinnamon, cloves

Steep a heaping teaspoonful in 8 ounces of boiling water. Cover and allow to steep for 5-8 minutes, then strain and enjoy! You can sweeten with honey, sugar, or sweetener of choice if desired, and could also steep in apple juice to give it a cozy apple cider flavor.

LEMON BALM

Known for its ability to help calm the body, lemon balm can also help with tummy issues.

HAWTHORN LEAVES AND BERRIES

Strongly supports heart health, has antioxidant benefits, and may help to reduce high blood pressure.

APPLE

Yummy and rich in vitamins and minerals.

ORANGE PEEL

May support digestive health and provide vitamins and minerals.

CINNAMON

A spicy tree bark, cinnamon can help reduce inflammation, support digestion, help improve gut health, and provide warmth to your body alongside other benefits.

CLOVE

Spicy and fragrant, cloves can help reduce inflammation, reduce bloating and digestive issues, and can provide antioxidants for the body.

name: Heirloom Tomato Candle
description:
This candle looks good enough to eat!

Introducing our NEW heirloom tomato beeswax candles as part of our Summer Farmer’s Market candle collection!

This tomato measures approximately 2.75” wide by 2” tall and has a burn time of approximately 20 hours.

The tomatoes are crafted with pure beeswax, a lead-free cotton wick, and eco-friendly non-toxic dyes!

They would be darling for:

  • A summer birthday party candle

  • A hostess gift

  • A spring/summer picnic candle

  • Or just to enjoy as-is!

CANDLE CARE:

Allow the candle to burn for 4 hours at a time. When the candle begins to tunnel or form walls of wax, gently push those walls in to the flame to allow the candle to keep burning evenly!

name: Herbal Magnesium Butter
description:
This moisturizing butter can help provide your daily source of magnesium. When applied topically, it absorbs into the skin within 30 seconds. It can be used to relieve aching muscles, cramps, and tension in the neck or body, and can help with sleep support. It can also be used as a deodorant and applied to your belly for digestive support.

It has the texture of actual butter. It is creamy, smooth, and silky, and goes on without feeling overly greasy or heavy.

SCENT PROFILE

  • Masala Chai — This smells like a cozy cup of chai with subtle yet sweet notes of spices and tea. NOTE: we improved the scent to be a bit stronger!!

  • Lavender — This has an earthy version of the lavender scent we know and love! It’s very grounding and gentle, like the whole lavender plant.

  • Vanilla — This has the scent that our vanilla cloud has! A beautiful vanilla, frosting-like scent.

Ingredients — Organic cold-pressed jojoba oil, grass-fed house-rendered tallow, shea butter, USP-grade lanolin, beeswax, candelilla wax (a natural wax that acts as an emulsifier), magnesium chloride flakes, fresh spring water from mountains near Redding, California, Geogard 221 (0.2%, an eco-certified preservative), herbs or spices (Vanilla: vanilla beans; Lavender: organic lavender buds; Masala Chai: black tea, all organic ceylon cinnamon, cloves, ginger, and cardamom)

NOTE: When water is mixed with oil, it creates the potential for bacterial growth, regardless of how clean or safely it was made. An actual preservative is needed if it will be stored at room temperature. Preservatives are NOT vitamin E or rosemary oil, as those do not inhibit bacterial growth. When working with water and oil, we wanted to avoid any reactions that occur when bacteria are introduced to the jar. This naturally happens each time the butter is scooped out with bare hands! We chose to use a clean, safe preservative because the benefits greatly outweigh the risks of bacterial contamination. We still recommend using clean hands to scoop out the magnesium butter, but you can rest easy knowing that no other bacteria will be introduced and grow in the butter!

comes in a 4-ounce amber glass jar

name: Herbal Magnesium Mist
description:
Magnesium has been used for centuries, dating back to Ancient Greece and Rome.

The word “magnesium” comes from the district Magnesia in Greece, where it was first discovered. The ancient Greeks and Romans believed that bathing regularly was an important practice for good health. They would bathe in sulfur baths, mineral-rich baths, and hot and cold spring water. Magnesium was abundant in one of the baths that was used for therapeutic reasons. It was later discovered by a physician in the 1800s who formally wrote about the benefits of magnesium and why it works.

Magnesium is a vital mineral that is responsible for over 300 reactions in the body. It is the eighth most abundant mineral on planet Earth and is an inexpensive way to take in your daily magnesium.

Our Herbal Magnesium Mist is made from magnesium chloride flakes, spring water, and herbs or spices. The herbs are infused into the water using a potent extraction method and then combined with the magnesium to make an herbal-rich mineral spray. Magnesium can be absorbed through the skin within 30 seconds of applying!

This spray is fragrant, potent, and in an easy-to-use spray bottle!

Magnesium may help with:
⁃ Sleep trouble
⁃ Stress
⁃ Anxiety
⁃ Digestive issues
⁃ Aching muscles
⁃ Skin health
⁃ Armpit odor
⁃ And more!

DIRECTIONS:

Apply 5-7 sprays to the skin daily to facilitate magnesium absorption, or onto the stomach to aid digestion. Each application of 7 sprays provides approximately 100-150mg of magnesium, which aligns with the recommended daily topical allowance for adults. Allow to sit for at least 15 minutes for best results, or you can apply before going to bed.

If you experience tingling or itchiness on the skin post-application, it may indicate a potential magnesium deficiency. Adjust the application frequency accordingly, starting with a lower dosage and gradually increasing as tolerated.

Ingredients - Spring water, magnesium chloride flakes, herbs or spices (Lavender: wildcrafted calendula, organic lavender buds, wildcrafted comfrey leaf; Masala Chai: black tea leaves, all organic ceylon cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, ginger)

comes in a 2 ounce amber glass spray bottle

name: Herbal Sitz Bath
description:
This bath mixture was formulated to provide a fragrant, calming support during those tender postpartum days. These herbs work together to provide a potent, soothing experience. They may support wound healing, skin health, and elasticity, and may offer relief for hemorrhoids or rashes. The herbs are considered gentle enough to be used by all ages, but a patch test is recommended. Enjoy as a peri rinse, sitz bath, or an herbal bath.

Peri rinse – Steep 1-2 tablespoons of herbs in 8 ounces of hot or boiling water. Cover as it steeps to prevent the medicinal steam from escaping. When cooled down to a skin-safe temperature, strain and add to a peri rinse bottle, either straight or diluted with half water, half herbal infusion. Refrigerate any leftover herbal infusion for up to 7 days. Compost any remaining herbs after steeping.

Sitz bath – Steep 1/2 to 1 cup of herbs in 1 quart of boiling water. Allow to steep for 10-20 minutes, covered to prevent the medicinal steam from escaping. After steeping, strain and add to a sitz bath and soak for 10-20 minutes. Compost any remaining herbs after steeping.

Herbal bath – Add 1-2 cups of herbs to a cloth bag or a metal sieve. If using a cloth bag, add the bag directly to a warm or hot bath and allow it to steep for the entirety of the bath. If using a metal sieve, allow the hot bath water to run over the herbs as the tub fills up. Alternatively, steep herbs separately in a jar or bowl with 1 quart boiling water, then strain and add the infusion to the bath. Compost any remaining herbs after steeping.

Ingredients — All organic or wildcrafted rose petals (Rosa spp.), calendula flowers (Calendula officinalis), uva ursi (Arctostaphylos uva-ursi), lavender buds (Lavandula), gotu kola (Centella asiatica), yarrow flowers (Achillea millefolium), chamomile flowers (Matricaria chamomilla), marshmallow root (Althaea officinalis), plantain leaf (Plantago major)

Comes in a 3.5-ounce resealable pouch

name: Hops Elixir
description:
Humulus Lupulus

ABOUT: 

Hops is a flower that may provide much-needed support for a tired body. It may support those with irritable coughs or lung spasms, those with rheumatism and inflammatory conditions, and those with liver or stomach conditions. It is especially helpful for those with nervous system dysregulation and side effects from feeling anxious or nervous. For women with menstrual cramps, hops may be supportive and help to relieve pain and relax the body. For those struggling with restlessness and insomnia or trouble falling asleep, hops may be supportive as it can help to gently sedate the body and promote calm, slow spiraling thoughts, and to also cool the body.

ACTIONS: 

Anaphrodisiac

Antimicrobial

Antispasmodic

Astringent

Bitter

Diuretic

Nervine

Sedative

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

name: Large Cream Sheepskin
description:
ABOUT

They measure approximately 45" long and 26" wide. The size varies and they might be a couple of inches smaller or larger. The fur ranges from 2" thick to 5" thick. Each sheepskin will vary in their shade of cream, ranging from a darker cream to a lighter one. This is a good sign as the sheepskins are not bleached!

They are soft, they are cozy, AND they have some medicinal benefits. The fuzzy fiber that gives warmth and protection to sheep is actually healing and beneficial to humans as well. Sheepskins are typically 3-4 feet long and can vary in color depending on the breed of sheep.

Sheepskin date back to the beginning of time, with clothes or bedding being fashioned from the skins. Sheepskins were once used to collect gold in riverbeds, prevent bedsores, warm hands and feet in winter, and used to wrap babies up to protect them from bitter winter winds. Many cultures have sheepskin as a normal part of their bedding and clothing. With an incredibly high signature frequency of 5,000 (compared to 100 for the human body), wool can work to uplift the body and not add extra stress that synthetic fibers can add to our bodies. When mixed with linen, which actually also has a signature frequency of 5,000, the two fibers can cancel each other out and collapse the energy field. Because of this, it’s best to pick one fiber or the other and try not to mix the two or wear both at the same time for the best benefits.

My babies LOVE “sheepskin naps.” It is a phrase I started to use a few years ago when my daughter was born. She would rest so deeply and peacefully when she napped on a sheepskin, and from that day onward we started traveling with a sheepskin so she could have a sheepskin nap everywhere we went. My son has napped on a sheepskin every day of his life! Sheepskins can also be used for patients staying in their bed for many hours at a time, and those that develop bedsores. Sheepskin helps relieve pressure from the pressure points and works to regulate the body’s temperature, making it a cozy and soft thing to lay on. When looking for a sheepskin, get your nose into the fibers and take a big whiff! The sheepskin should feel soft and fuzzy, not dry, and should have a slight sheep-y smell. This is a good sign that the lanolin is still intact! If you can ask, try to find out if the sheepskin has been bleached, which strips the fibers of lanolin and leaves the fur very white but very dry.

When cared for, a sheepskin can last decades and can be passed along to the generations after you. They are a beautiful heirloom gift. These come from Europe where the skins go through a traditional tanning method referred to as "vegetable tanning." The skins are soaked in salt water, then treated with gentle vegetable-and-plant derived substances. They are free from chromium, formaldehyde, eulan, formalin, PCB, optical brighteners, plasticizers, etc. The lanolin is largely preserved in this method, leaving a good amount of medicinal benefits.

DISCLAIMER: These are a natural product and as such will have some imperfections that make them unique. This may include: 

  • “armpits” which are on four corners of the sheepskin. Sheep naturally don’t grow fur there so they may appear to be bald patches! 

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality.

name: Lion's Mane Elixir
description:
LION’S MANE

hericium erinaceus

This elixir is made with permission using Arielle de Martinez's method. (Her website is here.) Her method utilizes alcohol, heat, and water to extract all the beneficial constituents from Lion's Mane. A mushroom supplement should be heated in order to release all the beneficial polysaccharides. 

This elixir contains alcohol, reverse osmosis water, raw honey, and non-GMO, food-grade, palm-derived glycerin. The reverse osmosis water is "hungry" and seeks out minerals, pulling beneficial goodness from the mushrooms. The honey adds a touch of sweetness and medicinal qualities, and the small amount of glycerin helps to suspend Lion’s Mane so each dose is a balanced one. The alcohol is necessary for one of the extraction parts, but in the final dose it is a balanced amount of alcohol, water, honey, and glycerin. 

ABOUT: 

Lion's Mane is a fluffy mushroom that resembles a white mane. 

It has been tested for its ability to protect and repair the brain. Parts of the constituents in lion's mane have been shown in studies to cross the blood-brain barrier, making it an amazing supplement for those with brain injuries, Alzeihmer's, dementia, and those with trouble focusing. 

Lion's mane has anti-tüm0r properties that seem to favor c@nc3r in the liver and digestive tract. 

Studies that showed lion's mane is beneficial for supporting the brain also showed it worked best when taken regularly, and that the memory seemed to return back to its pre-supplement state when lion's mane was stopped. 

Lion's mane can help calm an overactive immune system and can help boost an underactive immune system. It is also beneficial for the gut, offering protection and anti-inflammatory properties. It has styptic properties which can help with ulcers. 

Lion's mane with its anti-inflammatory properties can help with concussions, brain injuries and headaches due to those injuries. 

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

No negative reactions to Lion's Mane have been documented. It is considered safe to use by all ages, including women who are pregnant. 

Lion's mane might interact with blood thinners, so a little research before taking lion's mane might be a good idea. 

ACTIONS: 

Anti-c@ńcêr

Anti-tūm0r

Anti-viral

Anti-inflammatory

Anti-diabetic

Antibacterial

Antioxidant

Cardioprotective

Immunomodulator

Immunostimulant

Nervine

Neuroprotective

Neuroregenerative

DOSAGE: 

Lion's Mane is best when taken regularly. You can try taking 2-3 dropperfuls, 2x a day. For children, you can try 1 dropperful, 2x a day, and adjust as needed. 

INGREDIENTS:

Lion's mane mushroom

Grain alcohol

Raw honey

Food-grade, non-GMO palm-derived glycerin

Reverse osmosis water

name: Long-handled Dish Brush
description:
A solid beech wood body with sisal bristles. This brush is plastic-free.

Sisal is made from the fibers of the agave plant (agave sisalana) and are sturdy enough to scrub away food particles.

Beech is a hard wood that is resistant to water. These brushes are not sealed and are toxin-free.

Replace the head when the bristles are flat and the brush no longer scrubs as you’d like it to. We recommend composting the used brush head at the end of its life.

To replace the head, simply pull firmly and remove the head from the metal prongs. Insert a fresh brush head and scrub away!

name: Lung Support - Herbal Tea
description:
(Previously Renew Tea)

These herbs and flowers work together to gently restore vitamins and minerals to the body, help to cleanse the lungs, and help with herbal iron and digestive support. It is amazing for those with coughs, bronchitis, or digestive troubles. It is tart and tangy and earthy all at the same time.

I formulated this to help with cleansing my lungs during smoky days or during sickness, and it can also help to support the body through providing vital minerals, help to soothe upset stomachs, and more!

name: Lung Support Blend
description:
This blend was crafted to support the respiratory system. The herbs, roots, and mushrooms have all been traditionally used to support the airways of the body. The moistening actions of some of the herbs help the body through dry, aching coughs. This blend may support those with asthma or bronchitis, deep, barking coughs, old coughs that seem to linger, lung spasms, aching lungs, and mucus that cannot seem to work its way up and out of the body. This blend may also support gentle energy levels after bouts with fatigue, and may help to cool the body when working through hot sicknesses.

This blend was inspired by the work of RJ Whelan and his herbal suggestions for lung support.

name: Magnesium Flakes
description:
Magnesium is a crucial mineral that supports over 300 reactions in the body. Magnesium chloride comes from the brine of the Dead Sea water. It can be used to help relax tense muscles, help relieve stuck digestion, or to help promote relaxation, and is meant to be absorbed topically. When used topically, it begins absorbing within 30 seconds.

USES — relaxing the body - muscle relaxation - topical absorption of magnesium - sleep support - circulatory support - detoxification support - digestive support - skin health

and more!

DIRECTIONS — Add 1- 2 cups of flakes, or up to one bag, to a very warm or hot bath or foot soak. Soak for 20 minutes to receive the benefits that the magnesium offers. If itching occurs, try lowering the amount of salt used in the bath, as that is often a sign of magnesium deficiency, and it requires magnesium to be increased slowly.

Comes in a 25-ounce resealable pouch

Adaptogenic

Anti-inflammatory

description:
This tea was designed with mamas in mind. Through every stage of life, mothers pour out their love and care for those around them. description:
A wonderful root, the marshmallow plant offers a wide variety of benefits for the body.

It can be used to help soothe an inflamed digestive tract and help conditions like gastritis, reflux, colic, and more. Its moistening effect can be used to help treat coughs like bronchitis and help soothe lung spasms. It can help to moisten those dry, painful coughs and provide some relief.

Marshmallow root was also used for treating sore throats, toothaches, and urinary infections and irritations. It can be taken to soothe the body internally and also help with diarrhea, pneumonia, and more.

Wherever the body needs some extra moisture or help relieve dry, painful conditions, marshmallow root can help!

It is a great remedy for those with kidney issues, and urinary tract infections. It can also help to ease any pain associated with constipation and gas.

Those with ulcers might also benefit from marshmallow root!

This tincture was made using a dual-extraction method. It contains vodka, reverse osmosis water, and fresh marshmallow root.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Masala Chai
description:
MASALA CHAI

Another yummy blend from Nicole at Dancing Fern Folk Apothecary! I asked her to create some cozy autumn drinks and she came through! This is the year-round version of her popular Autumn Chai.

This chai comes in an amber jar and has 2 ounces of drink mix in it, which is enough for around 16 servings servings depending on how strong you like your chai.

The mixture contains Black tea, cardamom, ginger, clove, star anise, cinnamon, and peppercorns. It tastes cozy and has a good anise flavor that comes through alongside the cardamom!

It comes unsweetened, so we recommend adding 2 tsp drink mix to 6 ounces liquid of choice (raw milk!) along with 1-2 tablespoons sweetener of choice (I love raw sugar, Nicole loves maple syrup!) for a cozy drink. You can add 2 ounces of milk or cream to give it that creamy taste.

A little about each ingredient:

BLACK TEA

Used for thousands of years, black tea is rich in antioxidants, helps to stabilize blood sugar, helps to gently aid in detoxing your body, and much more!

CARDAMOM

A fragrant pod that can help reduce inflammation, help support digestion, bring antioxidant benefits to the body, and help support the liver.

CINNAMON

A spicy tree bark, cinnamon can help reduce inflammation, support digestion, help improve gut health, and provide warmth to your body alongside other benefits.

GINGER

Often used as a digestive aid, ginger can help support digestion, gently warm the body, and help to ease stomachaches and pains. It can also help to reduce nausea.

CLOVE

Spicy and fragrant, cloves can help reduce inflammation, reduce bloating and digestive issues, and can provide antioxidants for the body.

STAR ANISE

Shaped like a star as the name suggests, this fragrant pod can help promote good digestion, help prevent fungal infections, and can support the body through stomachaches and sickness.

PEPPERCORNS

 These spicy seeds can help reduce inflammation, stabilize blood sugar, and help your gut stay healthy.

name: Masala Chai Candle
description:
Our herb-infused tallow candles were the first on the market, utilizing scents from herbs and spices without using essential oils.

Our signature masala chai tallow and beeswax candle is a proprietary blend of herbs, spices, and tea leaves. The ingredients are slowly infused with the tallow and beeswax to produce a yummy finished product!

name: Matcha & Spearmint Soap
description:
This is a creamy bar with a gentle lather and rich, moisturizing ingredients!

These bars are crafted from organic ingredients. The fats and oils work together to make a dreamy bar of soap that won't dry out your skin. This soap is gentle enough for use on your hands or body and is a gentle degreaser while also still being moisturizing for your skin. All ingredients are organic or wildcrafted.

MATCHA & SPEARMINT SOAP INGREDIENTS —

  • cocoa butter

  • spearmint

  • matcha

name: Meadow - Soothing Botanical Mist
description:
Meet: meadow. A potent botanical mist designed with women in mind.

Previously called “Soothing Botanical Mist” but tweaked a bit to be extra potent.

This botanical mist was designed as a peri spray for postpartum healing, but can also be used as a facial toner, for diaper rashes, minor cuts and scrapes! The herbs are known to be soothing, help promote healing and gently wash wounds, they’re astringent and help to pull tissues back together, and they’re known to promote healthy skin when used topically.

I chose the name “meadow” because of how many flowers are in this mist. Those tender postpartum days can hold so much change and movement, so much joy and sorrow mingled together. We’ve lost some of the beautiful ancient practices that our ancestors used. I imagine grandmothers, aunts, mothers, and sisters going out into a meadow to gather beautiful flowers and bring them back to make into a soothing soak or spritz for a mama freshly postpartum, to weave them in her hair and shower her with love as she heals.

That image is what I carry when I think of “meadow.”

Postpartum is defined as a period of time after having a baby. As many of you know, I experienced 3 seasons of postpartum where I birthed but had empty arms. I grieved as my body processed the swift change and mourned the loss of my babies. I’ve also experienced postpartum where I held living babies in my arms and worked through those emotions and that time of healing. Both experiences fall under the “postpartum” category. I wish I could be there to walk each of you through postpartum, through life, through the many joys and sorrows of life! I love the “village” aspect and long for each of us to have a village around us. “Meadow” is my attempt at bringing a bit of soothing to each of you from afar. 🌱

I carefully worded the label so that all mamas can use this spray without being triggered by looking at the label.

SCENT PROFILE: The spray has an earthy and warm scent, with the helichrysum coming through first

INGREDIENTS: organic witch hazel (14% alcohol), calendula, lavender, marshmallow root, rose petals, chamomile, yarrow, gotu kola, helichrysum

TO USE: spritz on the skin as needed! It can be used as: 

- A healing peri spray for after labor, or after a miscarriage, to encourage the skin to heal 

- A facial toner

- A spray for wounds or scrapes

- A spray for diaper rashes or other rashes 

- A spray for hemorrhoids 

You can try:

Misting this on your face after a shower or a long day in the sun, and top with tallow to seal in that moisture.

Spritzing a bit on your baby's bum after a diaper change to help soothe rashes.

For use as a peri spray, you can remove the straw in the bottle so you can hold the bottle upside down and spritz. I recommend applying the spray after every time you use the bathroom. For use with hemorrhoids, apply after every time you use the bathroom. 

The mist comes in a 2-ounce glass spray bottle.

name: Merino Roving Wool
description:
This wool is buttery soft and ready for your felting or crafting projects! Each color is either a 5g ball (roughly 8 inches in length when unrolled) or a 1 ounce bundle (roughly 3 feet in length) and are priced accordingly!

ABOUT: Merino Wool Combed Top from the UK, Ethically sourced from New Zealand and South American sheep farms that adhere to strict animal welfare regulations.

Mulesing-free!

Carefully selected for quality, then combed and dyed in England with Oeko-Tex approved dyes - safe for the environment, and safe for you! This combed Merino Wool top is 21.5 microns, and is popular for use in needle felting, wet felting, and spinning. The wool takes color well, so we are able to offer a wide range of vibrant colors.

We have done our best to display the colors as accurately and true as possible, but dye lots may differ slightly, and monitors may display colors differently.

name: Milky Oats Tincture
description:
Milky Oats

avena sativa

Milky Oats tincture is made from young oat heads. Most people think of "oats" when imagining the oat plant, but this tincture is made from the immature buds and are harvested before they are dried. The immature buds contain a healing latex that can only be utilized when processed fresh.

Milky Oats tincture is for those that experience stressors of any kind. Women who are pregnant, women in their postpartum period, those with work stress, women who have experienced a miscarriage or loss, those suffering from PTSD, those who are overworked, and those who are tired can all benefit from using milky oats. 

When our bodies are stressed, they burn through their mineral storage rapidly. If that storage is not refilled, our bodies can remain in that survival mode. Milky oats are a trophorestorative, which can help repair a depleted nervous system and allow the body to rebuild its mineral storage. 

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

Those allergic to latex should research to see if this tincture is beneficial for your body. Those with oat allergies should also be aware of the ingredients. Milky oats are considered safe to be used by all ages, young and old, and women who are pregnant or breastfeeding. 

DOSAGE: 

You can try 2-3ml, 1-3x a day or as needed. Best when consumed daily. 

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Motherwort Elixir
description:
Buy 2, Save $3!

Leonurus cardiaca

ABOUT:

As the Latin name shows, Motherwort is called “Lion-hearted” and is beneficial for all things relating to the heart. It was traditionally used to help regulate high blood pressure and calm a racing heart. It can be used to help treat cardiac disorders, lower high blood pressure, regulate heart palpitations, and calm the body.

If menstruation is delayed (without pregnancy), motherwort can be used to encourage the uterus to relax and stimulate it to begin moving blood down and out. It can be used to ease the pain of cramps, and any headaches or mood swings that might accompany your period.

Motherwort is a postpartum must-have for mamas (grab 2 bottles!). It can assist with allowing the uterus to bleed and prevent uterine infection and can help an emotional mama feel more lion-hearted when emotions can seem all over the place. It can often be described as a warm hug from a mother when needed most. It can help ease the pain of afterbirth cramping, while the honey from the elixir can give extra minerals to the mama.

As a nervine, motherwort works to calm the body and help relieve stress and nervous restlessness. It can be used to calm an over-anxious heart and shift any emotions of feeling “stuck”

ACTIONS:

Antispasmodic

Bitter

Nervine

Emmenagogue

Hepatic

Anti-inflammatory

Hypotensive

Uterine tonic

Diaphoretic

You can try 1-3ml, 2-3x a day or as needed, or just one dropperful if needed to calm anxiety.

name: Mugwort Tincture
description:
This fragrant plant was traditionally used to help the female reproductive system. It can help to support the menstrual cycle, help to slow excessive menstrual bleeding, warm the womb, and can also help to bring on menstruation if it seems to be delayed for no known reason.

Mugwort is also useful for promoting circulation within the body. It is also a nervine and can be used to help soothe the body. Mugwort can be reached for when needing stomach support,  such as help digesting food or help with stomachaches. It can also be used topically in tea or tincture form to help soothe reactions like that caused by poison ivy. Native Americans leaned on mugwort for dream support, as it is said to help to increase vivid dreaming.

name: Mullein Elixir
description:
Verbascum thapsus

ABOUT

Mullein is your friend for all things respiratory support. Mullein has been known to help with coughs and colds and can be an incredible help during winter months when congestion and respiratory issues seems to abound. 

Containing saponins that work to loosen mucus and allow the body to cough up congestion, it tends to gravitate towards the upper respiratory tract and can alleviate bronchitis and coughs that seem to linger. Its leaves are fuzzy and soft, but it packs a powerful punch when tackling lung issues. It is both moistening and cooling, soothing inflammation of the trachea and larynx. The addition of raw honey can soothe sore throats and provide medicinal benefits. 

It is a diuretic, helping to cleanse the body through urination. Mullein can also be reached for when you have acute inflammation such as back pain or musculoskeletal injuries, as it is a mild relaxant. 

Mullein is your friend for cleansing, for moving things up and out of the body. It can be used by all ages, babies and up, and by breastfeeding mamas. 

Some mothers prefer to not give honey before the age of 1. I encourage you to do your research and go with what you are comfortable with! 

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

None known. 

ACTIONS: 

Demulcent

Expectorant

Lung tonic

Diuretic

Antispasmodic

Anti-inflammatory

Mild Nervine

DOSAGE: 

Mullein does best with smaller, more frequent doses. You can try 1-2ml every few hours, or as needed.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Mushroom Blend
description:
This mushroom blend was crafted to support overall vitality in the body. The mushrooms are known to support the liver, heart, lungs, reproductive organs, kidneys, stomach, and more. They may offer gentle immune support while supporting the body’s overall hormonal health. This blend may help to provide gentle and sustained energy, mental clarity, hormonal support, blood sugar support, allergy support, and may help the body’s ability to adapt to stress. The mushrooms have all been triple-extracted for maximum potency.

Ingredients — All wildcrafted or wood grown reishi fruiting body (ganoderma lucidum),* cordyceps fruiting body (cordyceps militaris),* maitake fruting body (grifola frondosa),* chaga fruiting body (inonotus obliquus),* grain alcohol, spring water, non-GMO palm-derived glycerin, raw honey *heated for full benefits

Reishi, turkey tail, tremella elixir, lion's mane, cordyceps, maitake, and chaga all have incredible immune support and anti-c@ncer benefits, and they complement each other well.

Save $15 with this bundle!

description:
The blend focuses on nervous system support, and more specifically, nervous digestion support. This can be taken to support feelings of panic leading up to big events, for feelings of anxiety that sit in the stomach, for children who struggle with thoughts of going to bed or winding down, and for individuals who may experience more stress in situations that are unpredictable. It may support keeping the body calm and relaxed, uplifting the mood, and offering digestive support, especially if the feelings of nervousness bring up heat.

This blend was created by Evolutionary Herbalism on their public blog.

Ingredients — Wildcrafted fresh extracts of lemon balm (melissa officinalis), catnip (nepeta cataria), tulsi (ocimum africanum), 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol, spring water), raw honey

description:
The blend focuses on nervous system support, and more specifically, bringing happiness back into the body after or during seasons of stress. The herbs work together to support a depleted nervous system, burnout, a tired mind, racing and circular thoughts, overly critical thoughts, nervous pain and tension, insomnia, and more. This may support the body through times where happiness feels far away, or when calm is needed. Note: Shake before using to disperse the latex.

This blend was created by Evolutionary Herbalism on thier public blog.

Urtica Dioica

Nettle can be used as an herbal iron supplement, and can also be used for extra minerals. Some minerals are preserved through the tincture. 

Nettle has also been used to help mothers increase their milk supply. 

It can be used as a cleansing herb, flushing the body and specifically the kidneys. It can be taken internally and used for skin issues such as eczema. 

It is a mild styptic and can be used to help with internal bleeding or nose bleeds. It can also be used to support the body during seasonal allergies or asthma attacks. 

Nettle is a beautiful herbal friend to have on hand!

name: Nipple Balm
description:
previously called “nurture”

A rich, soothing balm designed with mamas and babies in mind. Those tender postpartum days are so sacred and can be filled with swirling emotions and shifts in hormones. This balm was designed to help support mama and baby during those tender days. The herbs and oils were carefully chosen to provide potent healing for chapped skin, rashes, fresh baby skin, and stretch marks, and can be used as a diaper cream or nursing balm.

Calendula is known as a sunshine flower, supporting skin with antifungal properties, anti-inflammatory properties, and promoting wound healing. It has also traditionally been used to heal scars.

Chamomile flowers are known to be soothing and calming, offering healing support for chapped skin.

Nettle leaf is filled with nutrients that are skin-supportive, helping to heal skin.

Rose petals are uplifting in nature, providing soothing support for skin.

Marshmallow root is rich in nutrients that help to heal the skin and soothe inflammation.

Lanolin is the fat from sheep’s wool, known for its high-frequency and ability to help soothe inflamed skin conditions. It is a deeply healing fat that locks in moisture and promotes wound-healing.

You’re doing great, mama, as you nurture another sweet soul.

This balm has a fairly neutral scent with the cocoa butter scent coming through on top.

Ingredients — Organic cold-pressed jojoba oil, cocoa butter, USP-grade small-farm lanolin, and beeswax infused with extracts from all wildcrafted calendula flowers, nettle, chamomile flowers, rose petals, and marshmallow root

comes in a 2-ounce glass amber jar

name: Nourish - Herbal Tea
description:
This tea blend was created to help replenish a depleted mineral reserve. In times of stress the body often burns through minerals quickly. This tea contains herbs that are rich in vital nutrients and can help to deeply nourish the body.

Enjoy this tea on a daily basis or as needed.

We recommend savoring a cup during moments of solitude to allow your body to relax and mindfully enjoy each sip.

INGREDIENTS: (all organic or wildcrafted)

Red raspberry leaf - uterine tonic, supports the female body, rich in minerals

Nettle - helps the bladder and kidneys function properly, provides herbal iron and minerals

Oat straw - rich in minerals, works to help soothe the body

Alfalfa - helps with bone health, rich in minerals and nutrients, supports the kidney and bladder

Red clover - provides a general soothing effect to the body, anti-inflammatory, helps with hormonal imbalances

Spearmint - aids in digestion, soothes gassy stomachs, helps with cramps, soothes nauseous tummies, provides cooling to the body

Rosehips -helps with healthy urination, high in vitamin C, rich in antioxidants, gentle detoxer

comes in a 1.5 oz pouch, with 16-20 servings

name: Oatmeal and Goat Milk Soap
description:
This is a creamy bar with a gentle lather and rich, moisturizing ingredients!

These bars are crafted from organic ingredients. The tallow is combined with the other ingredients to make a dreamy bar of soap that won't dry out your skin. This soap is gentle enough for use on your hands or body and is a gentle degreaser while also still being moisturizing for your skin. All ingredients are organic or wildcrafted.

Each bar measures roughly 2" by 3" by 1" (NEW SIZE!) and is approximately 4 ounces by weight

OATMEAL AND GOAT MILK —

  • tallow

  • coconut oil

  • goat milk

  • oats

  • lye (sodium hydroxide)

name: Oral Health Blend
description:
These herbs and spices have properties that may help support the oral microbiome. Echinacea root, spilanthes, yarrow, and clove have all been traditionally used to treat tooth infections, gum disease, bad breath, mouth sores, oral nerve pain, and healing of cuts and wounds when used orally. Use daily, or as needed, as a mouth rinse to support oral health. This blend is safe to ingest and swallow, but for oral support it is recommended that you swish to distribute the herbal extracts around the mouth, teeth, and gums, and spit out after.

To use: Drop 2-3 droppers full in a small amount of water. Swish vigorously for 30 seconds before spitting out. Repeat daily.

Ingredients — Wildcrafted extracts of fresh yarrow (achillea millefolium), spilanthes (acmella oleracea), echinacea (echinacea purpurea), clove (syzygium aromaticum), 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol, spring water)

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass dropper bottle

name: Peaceful Dragon - Herbal Tea
description:
This tea blend was created to help support littles ones, especially those with big emotions. Big emotions can seemingly take over their bodies as they process the world around them. The herbs in this tea help to promote a calm demeanor and help their brains move through the emotions in life. Whether sipped before bedtime or during challenging moments, this soothing tea gently supports a peaceful state of mind.

Enjoy this tea on a daily basis or as needed.

We recommend savoring a cup during moments of solitude to allow your body to relax and mindfully enjoy each sip.

INGREDIENTS: (all wildcrafted or organic)

Tulsi (Holy Basil) - an adaptogen and tonic used to protect the heart from stress, can enhance digestion, memory, concentration, and happiness.

Catnip - is soothing and settling to the nerves, bringing balance to the fire, and a great remedy for nerves and stress.

Spearmint - is a cooling herb that aids in memory, focus and is a great supportive herb in tea blends.

Lavender - is a relaxing nervine good for bringing balance to people who are overwhelmed, high-strung, or nervous.

Rosehips - are rich in vitamin C, uplifting, and good for reducing the impact of stress on the body.

Passionflower - is a relaxing nervine that helps to bring focus to the mind, stop spiraling thoughts and restlessness, and reduce tension.

comes in a 1.5 oz pouch, with 16-20 servings

name: Peony Candle
description:
This darling candle is crafted from 100% beeswax, a cotton wick, and eco-friendly, non-toxic dyes.

The burn time is approximately 15 hours and comes in two colors: dusty pink and deep red.

NOTE: These candles look like they can float, but sadly they did not pass the float test! But you might be able to float them on clear marbles in a vase and get the same effect!

name: Pine Tar Soap
description:
This is a creamy bar with a gentle lather and rich, moisturizing ingredients!

These bars are crafted from organic ingredients. The fats and oils work together to make a dreamy bar of soap that won't dry out your skin. This soap is gentle enough for use on your hands or body and is a gentle degreaser while also still being moisturizing for your skin. All ingredients are organic or wildcrafted.

Each bar measures roughly 2" by 3" by 1" (NEW SIZE!) and is approximately 4 ounces by weight

ABOUT — Pure pine tar is made from boiling down the sap from pine trees, yielding a very sticky syrup. (It is NOT coal tar!) It has been used traditionally in woodworking to help protect wood, and medicinally—externally— for skin. Pine tar contains constituents from the pine resin. Resins are the lifeblood of the tree, and they “bleed” when the tree is injured, as a way to protect and heal the wood. Those same properties apply when used on the skin! For more on pine tar, and a study done showing how it may support the skin, click here.

PINE TAR SOAP INGREDIENTS —

  • grass-fed beef tallow

  • olive oil

  • coconut oil

  • cocoa butter

  • avocado oil

  • pine tar

  • lye (sodium hydroxide)

  • water

NOTE: this has a beautiful scent profile thanks to the pine tar! It has an earthy, forest-y scent that is pronounced.

name: Pinecone Beeswax Candles
description:
This comes in a set with one large pinecone and one small pinecone. The large pinecone is approximately 3.75" tall and the small is approximately 2" tall.

These are crafted with 100% pure beeswax that smells like honey, a lead-free cotton wick, and added dyes that are eco-friendly and free from any and all harmful additives and ingredients like phthalates and parabens. Wild Oaks Apothecary approved!

Due to the nature of the dyes and that these are a handmade product, colors and shades may vary from pinecone to pinecone.

These are a darling addition to your autumn tablescape or decor, and would make a fun gift for a friend.

WHY BEESWAX? Beeswax burns slowly and cleanly, without excess soot, and has been said to release negative ions into the air which may help to purify the air. The glow is warm and closely resembles the golden glow from the sunset or sunrise, which is healing for the eyes.

WICK CARE - Trim wick to 1/2 before lighting. For best results, allow to burn for 1-2 hours minimum each time you light it. This helps to avoid tunneling, and helps the pinecones burn to the edges. Pinch off the excess wick before re-lighting. For best results, burn on a small metal or ceramic plate to avoid any drip page.

BURN TIME - Burn time is approximately:

large pinecone — 10 hours

small pinecone — 3 - 3.5  hours

name: Plantain Salve
description:
A rich, green-colored-salve that will be your friend for those pesky bug bites and itchy rashes!

Plantain salve can be applied to bug bites, stings, rashes, and superficial cuts as needed. 

The salve comes in a 2-ounce metal tin.

name: Propolis Throat Spray
description:
This blend was crafted with the intention of soothing sore, inflamed throats. The herbs in this blend have all traditionally been used to support sore throats, offer a numbing sensation, and help kill bacteria that can lead to infections like strep. This blend also offers immune support.

Propolis is a sticky resin that comes from the beeswax and honey-making process, gathered and produced by bees. One of the uses of propolis is to prevent bacteria from entering the hives, and to protect the hives from leaks and from invaders. Propolis has a similar effect on the body, supporting the immune system and fighting off harmful bacteria.

Spray 2-4 sprays at the back of the throat, at first sign of a sore throat. Repeat as often as needed.

Ingredients — Wildcrafted extracts of fresh echinacea (echinacea purpurea), spilanthes (acmella oleracea), yarrow (achillea millefolium), propolis extract, 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol, spring water)

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass spray bottle

name: Pumpkin Beeswax Candle
description:
This darling pumpkin is almost too cute to burn. It is made from 100% pure beeswax with a rich honey scent, and a cotton lead-free wick.

This comes in two options:

  • Plain beeswax

  • Autumn pumpkin (a beautiful shade of orange. Due to the dye and that this is a handmade product, variations in color shades may occur from pumpkin to pumpkin)

The autumn pumpkin has added dyes that are eco-friendly and free from any and all harmful additives and ingredients like phthalates and parabens. Wild Oaks Apothecary approved!

This candle weighs a whopping 14 ounces, nearly an entire pound of beeswax! They make for cute centerpieces, fireplace mantle decor, or countertop decor, and would be a fun addition to your Thanksgiving tablescape. It measures approximately 4” across and 2.5” tall  

WHY BEESWAX? Beeswax burns slowly and cleanly, without excess soot, and has been said to release negative ions into the air which may help to purify the air. The glow is warm and closely resembles the golden glow from the sunset or sunrise, which is healing for the eyes.

WICK CARE - Trim the wick to 1/2 before lighting. For best results, allow it to burn for 4 hours minimum each time you light it. This helps to avoid tunneling and helps the pumpkin burn to the edges. Pinch off the excess wick before re-lighting.

BURN TIME - Burn time is approximately 30-35 hours depending on maintenance. You will be left with a bit of beeswax around the edges after the insides have burned out. We recommend saving those scraps to melt down into a new candle, to make beeswax wraps out of, or to have on hand to make wood butter or an easy salve!

name: Queen Anne's Lace Tincture
description:
This "weed" has some pretty amazing benefits! It has some poisonous lookalikes but is easy to identify once you know what to look for! It is a lookalike to hemlock, which is poisonous. Hemlock has a blotchy purple stem, whereas Queen Anne's Lace has a fuzzy stem! QAL has a tiny red flower in the center of the white cluster which helped to name the plants. Legend says that the Queen of England (1665-1714) pricked herself with a needle while making lace, and the flower resembles lace and a blood droplet. The fresh seeds and some leaves are used for this tincture.

The tincture acts as a diuretic, helping to flush the kidneys and liver and promote urination. It can help to counter kidney stone formation and help to flush those that have already formed. As a liver support, it can stimulate the flow of urine which can help to then remove the waste via the kidneys.

It can help to soothe the digestive tract and can help with stomach cramps from eating.

It was used historically as a contraceptive aid when taken in large, intentional, frequent amounts. It can also often help to encourage delayed menstruation that is not due to pregnancy.

It has some uterine-stimulating properties, so pregnant women might choose to avoid this during pregnancy in larger doses. I recommend taking small doses and seeing how your body responds! To cause "harm" to baby, LARGE amounts would have to be consumed (like, if you buy out my whole stock and drink them all at once!) but it is amazing when used medicinally!

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

name: Rael Organic Cotton Cover Pads
description:
About RAEL:

After growing up in South Korea, Aness moved to the states where she discovered a lack of safe and comfortable period products in the US. And as a new mom of twins, she didn’t want to settle. She joined forces with Yanghee and Binna to develop non-toxic and effective alternatives to conventional period products by combining the best of both worlds - organic cotton sourced from Texas and cutting-edge technology from South Korea. Thus, Rael was born.

3 months after launching on Amazon.com, Rael pads became a best-seller and Rael quickly became a leader in the organic feminine care category driven by glowing, organic reviews from real customers who fell in love with the products. The trio continued to expand Rael’s portfolio on a mission to reinvent feminine care with a fresh, holistic approach to hygiene, skincare, and cramp care with the goal of providing better, natural support for women throughout their cycle.

ORGANIC PADS

I chose this brand because I used them during my postpartum time, and for my monthly cycle, and love that they still address women in their wording.

The pads are made with a certified organic cotton top sheet, chlorine-free pulp, and absorbant polymer.

They are unscented.

Organic cotton pads are important for women, espeically because cotton is a highly sprayed crop. Those pesticides end up being absorbed by our skin and can affect hormones, fertility, and more.

Thus, Rael was born.

3 months after launching on Amazon.com, Rael pads became a best-seller and Rael quickly became a leader in the organic feminine care category driven by glowing, organic reviews from real customers who fell in love with the products. The trio continued to expand Rael’s portfolio on a mission to reinvent feminine care with a fresh, holistic approach to hygiene, skincare, and cramp care with the goal of providing better, natural support for women throughout their cycle.

ORGANIC PADS

I chose this brand because I used them during my postpartum time, and for my monthly cycle, and love that they still address women in their wording.

The pads are made with a certified organic cotton top sheet, chlorine-free pulp, and absorbant polymer.

They are unscented.

Organic cotton pads are important for women, espeically because cotton is a highly sprayed crop. Those pesticides end up being absorbed by our skin and can affect hormones, fertility, and more.

name: Red Raspberry Leaf Tincture
description:
Red raspberry leaf can be used for supporting the reproductive system, pregnancy, and the uterus. It is well known for its tea form, which supplies needed nutrients for expecting mothers, but the tincture form is also an amazing support for the reproductive system.

It can support digestion, help relieve nausea, help support the body through respiratory issues, soothe stomach ulcers, and help support the kidneys. It can also be used as a mouthwash to help heal any sore in the mouth as it has both astringent and healing properties.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Reishi & Cordyceps Blend
description:
Reishi and Cordyceps are renowned mushrooms, known for their support of various systems of the body. Together they may offer support for lung conditions, low energy levels, a frazzled nervous system, low libido, cholesterol levels, cardiovascular health, a healthy liver, allergies, cancer support, and overall calm for the body. Both mushrooms are well-studied and help support overall vitality for the body.

Ingredients — Cordyceps fruiting body (cordyceps militaris),* Reishi fruiting body (ganoderma lucidum),* grain alcohol, spring water, non-GMO palm-derived glycerin, raw honey *heated for full benefits

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass dropper bottle

name: Reishi Elixir
description:
REISHI
ganoderma lucidum

This elixir is made with permission using Arielle de Martinez's method. (Her website is here. Her method utilizes alcohol, heat, and water to extract all the beneficial constituents from reishi. A mushroom supplement should be heated in order to release all the beneficial polysaccharides. 

This elixir contains alcohol, Mount Shasta spring water, raw honey, and non-GMO, food-grade, palm-derived glycerin. The honey adds a touch of sweetness and medicinal qualities, and the small amount of glycerin helps to suspend reishi so each dose is a balanced one. The alcohol is necessary for one of the extraction parts, but in the final dose, it is a balanced amount of alcohol, water, honey, and glycerin. 

ABOUT: 

Reishi is an incredibly well-studied mushroom. With numerous studies available, reishi has been shown to have a wide variety of medicinal benefits. 

According to Chinese medicine, "Reishi positively affects the life-energy, or Qi of the heart, repairing the chest area and benefiting those with a knotted and tight chest. Taken over a long period of time the agility of the body will not cease, and the years are lengthened” L Shizhen from the year 1596.

Reishi can be taken to help the heart, liver, and many other parts of the body. 

It has been shown to be anti-c@ńcêr and anti-tūm0r (words censored because some parties don't appreciate herbs that have been shown to help said sickness.) In studies, reishi showed it would shrink tūm0rš and produce a 5-fold to twenty-nine-fold increase in 

c@ńcêr-fighting compounds (David Winston) It has been shown in Japan to relieve many side effects of räd!@tion and ch3m0thér@pÿ. (so sorry for the censoring!!!) It can help relieve fatigue that comes from many c-treatments, and help to regulate the immune system. 

It is a bitter mushroom and in turn, can help the liver. When taken half hour before a meal, and held in the mouth for a few moments before swallowing, reishi can act as bitter to stimulate the body's response to start digesting food. 

Reishi is best when taken daily, and consistently. 

Reishi has the ability to help balance out the immune system. It can lower the immune system when it is working too hard, or raise the immune system's response when it needs a boost. 

As a nervine, reishi can soothe a frazzled nervous system and help relieve stress. 

For those suffering from allergies (animal, environmental, and food) reishi can be used as a tool to help the body's histamine response. 

For those with asthma, bronchitis, or other lung ailments, reishi can be a beautiful support to help restore the body's proper function of the lungs. 

For a listing of over 120 studies about reishi, click here.

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

Some say that Reishi can reduce blood stickiness and counteract blood thinning medication. A little research should be done first before taking reishi alongside blood thinners, and it has generally been shown as a safe mushroom supplement. It can be taken in high doses or small doses by all ages, from young ones to the elderly. 

ACTIONS: 

Anti-c@ńcêr

Anti-tūm0r

Anti-viral

Antihistamine

Antibacterial

Expectorant

Hypotensive

Immunomodulator

Immunostimulant

Nervine

DOSAGE: 

Reishi is best when taken regularly. You can try taking 2-3 dropperfuls, 2x a day. For children, you can try 1 dropperful, 2x a day and adjust as needed.

name: Replacement Brush Head
description:
A solid beech wood body with sisal bristles. Plastic-free.

Sisal is made from the fibers of the agave plant (agave sisalana) and are sturdy enough to scrub away food particles.

Beech is a hard wood that is is resistant to water. These brushes are not sealed, and are toxin-free.

Replace the head when the bristles are flat and the brush no longer scrubs as you’d like it to. We recommend composting the used brush head at the end of its life.

name: Revive - Scalp Oil
description:
You all loved our nourishing scalp spray hydrosol, so I created this matching herbal hair oil! Our hydrosol will be back in stock in late spring/early summer, so until then you can use this oil!

This oil is made with all organic or wildcrafted rosemary, peppermint leaf, nettle leaf, and calendula blooms and is infused into organic, cold-pressed jojoba oil.

ROSEMARY — This herb has been used for centuries and is a special part of many belief systems. It was used in Greece by students who braided it into their hair to help them study. During the Renaissance period, rosemary was used by herbalists for their patients and it was also used by the French for many ailments. It was also considered to be a symbol of Christ, as it was supposed to only grow to the age of 33 years and never grow taller, only wider. It boasts anti-inflammatory and antioxidant benefits. Rosemary can help to stimulate hair growth by improving circulation to the scalp. It has been shown in many studies to encourage hair growth in people of all ages. It is also a gentle support for headaches, helping to relieve tension. It can promote scalp health along with its other benefits!

PEPPERMINT — This herb is well-known for its strong and fresh scent. Peppermint is an invasive plant that can help with a wide variety of ailments when taken internally, and when used externally it can help to relieve rashes, provide a cooling effect, and help to soothe itchy skin. It can help to revitalize the scalp and promote healthy skin, which is important for hair growth. In one study it has been shown to increase dermal thickness, follicle number, and follicle depth when applied topically on the scalp. That study (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4289931/) used peppermint essential oil which is a strong, highly isolated portion of the plant. In this hair oil, whole peppermint is utilized which yields a more potent, balanced version of the plant.

NETTLE LEAF — This stinging plant is rich in vitamins and minerals. Like peppermint and rosemary, stinging nettles can help to boost circulation when applied topically. Nettles contain antioxidants which can help encourage hair growth. It is an astringent that can help to gently cleanse the scalp and contains acids and fatty acids that can nourish the hair follicles and promote shiny hair. Nettle can also help to promote a healthy scalp. The vitamins and minerals found in nettles can help to coat the hair strands and promote healthy, shiny hair.

CALENDULA — A beautiful orange flower in the sunflower family, calendula is a powerful herb for skin support when used topically. Calendula can help to quickly heal wounds, soothe skin with its anti-inflammatory properties, and can help to promote a healthy scalp which is important for hair growth. Calendula can help promote follicle growth and can protect the hair strands as they grow.

Together these plants and flowers work to gently stimulate the scalp, encourage circulation, and encourage hair growth. The herbs are all infused into organic cold-pressed jojoba oil. It has a herby scent with the peppermint and rosemary coming through nicely. It has a beautiful, rich, green hue showing how potent the oil is!

To use: apply a few pumps (or enough to coat your scalp) to the palm of your hand and then massage the oil into your scalp with your fingertips. For best results, massage into the scalp for a few minutes. You can use this as an overnight or 20-minute treatment before you shower! You can also apply a few drops to your hair to help reduce frizz and encourage healthy shine.

name: Rooted Tallow
description:
Rooted is an earthy, grounding tallow balm. It starts with grass-fed tallow, rendered by us at our shop, which is then mixed with organic cold-pressed jojoba oil and beeswax. We add a blend of Frankincense and Myrrh resins, and begin a long and slow extraction method that has taken years to perfect. It’s such a potent extraction method that the balm goes from a white tallow color to a gorgeous light brown shade.

The smell is grounding and slightly perfumey. Both the frankincense and myrrh resins come through beautifully. The texture is what I’d describe as a “butter” texture. It’s creamy and easy to spread, and locks in moisture!

Frankincense and myrrh resin both come from trees. Resins are like a bandage for the tree. When a tree has a wound or a branch breaks off, liquid resins from the resin ducts come to the surface and harden, forming a sticky bandage. Resins have been used for centuries and are mentioned in ancient texts and manuscripts (including the Bible.)

Myrrh was commonly used during burial preparations, in perfume making, and for making medicine. It has antiseptic, carminative, and analgesic properties. Myrrh is the most ancient gum resin known to man, and the first scented plant mentioned in the Bible (when it was called “bdellium.”) The name ‘myrrh’ comes from the Arabic word ‘murr’, which means bitter.

Frankincense is a gum resin that has a rich history. It was a valuable incense and had nearly 5 times the demand that myrrh had. The scent is almost lemony, with lighter top notes. It was commonly used in temples as it was believed to heighten awareness and elevate thoughts. It was also once decreed by the Jews that only frankincense could be used for holy incense. It has rich medicinal benefits and has been used both internally and externally.

To use our tallow balms: Apply a hydrosol first, or plain water. While the skin is still damp, apply the tallow balm and gently massage in to lock in the moisture.

Ingredients — Grass-fed house-rendered tallow, organic cold-pressed jojojba oil, frankincese resin, myrrh resin, beeswax

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass jar

name: Rooted Tallow Oil
description:
This is a gentle, grounding oil formulated to offer deep support, potent resin extracts, and soothing oils and tallow to support healthy skin.

Myrrh was commonly used during burial preparations, in perfume making, and for making medicine. It has antiseptic, carminative, and analgesic properties. Myrrh is the most ancient gum resin known to man, and the first scented plant mentioned in the Bible (when it was called “bdellium.”) The name ‘myrrh’ comes from the Arabic word ‘murr’, which means bitter.

Frankincense is a gum resin that has a rich history. It was a valuable incense and had nearly 5 times the demand that myrrh had. The scent is almost lemony, with lighter top notes. It was commonly used in temples as it was believed to heighten awareness and elevate thoughts. It was also once decreed by the Jews that only frankincense could be used for holy incense. It has rich medicinal benefits and has been used both internally and externally.

Reishi is known as a supportive mushroom with compounds that support glowing skin

Ingredients - Organic jojoba oil, emu oil, myrrh resin (commiphora myrrha), frankincense resin (bo-swellia carteri), boswellic acid, reishi (ganoderma lucidum), grass-fed tallow, beeswax

comes in a 1.4 oz amber glass serum bottle with a dropper

name: Rose Cacao
description:
ADAPTOGENIC ROSE HOT COCOA

Now with MORE rose!

A collaboration with Dancing Fern Folk Apothecary for Wild Oaks Apothecary.

This adaptogenic hot cocoa was created to honor the traditions of sipping chocolate that have existed for thousands of years. It’s a tradition that invites us to slow down and enjoy a warm beverage alone or with loved ones.

This is our take on a hot cocoa, with added adaptogens to help soothe your body and allow it to better adapt to the stressors found in life. It has a hint of rose that is said to uplift the body, and it pairs well with the cacao flavor.

This powder comes in an amber jar and has 2.5 ounces of drink mix in it, which is enough for between 15-18 servings depending on how strong you like your hot cocoa.

The mixture contains cocoa, ashwagandha, chaga, vanilla bean, cinnamon, and cardamom. It tastes chocolatey and creamy with a hint of "something more."

It comes unsweetened, so we recommend adding 2 tsp drink mix to 8ounces liquid of choice (raw milk!) along with 1-2 tablespoons sweetener of choice (I love raw sugar, Nicole loves maple syrup!) for a cozy drink.

A little about each ingredient:

COCOA

Used for thousands of years, cacao/cocoa has amazing benefits for the body. It can act as an aphrodisiac, help to lower blood pressure, and provides amazing antioxidants and minerals along with magnesium.

ASHWAGANDHA

A beautiful root, ashwagandha can help to reduce stress, improve poor sleep, help to reduce inflammation, and can help with a wide variety of ailments in the body.

CHAGA

An amazing mushroom, chaga can help to reduce inflammation in the body, provide anti-tumor benefits, reduce blood pressure, and promote overall immune support.

VANILLA

A yummy pod from an orchid plant, vanilla can help to calm the body, provide some magnesium, help to relax the body and increase happy hormones.

ROSE

Known for its uplifting scent and aroma, rose adds a gentle taste with some antioxidant and vitamin C benefits.

Each jar contains 15-18 servings, depending on how strong you like your cocoa!

name: Rose Elixir
description:

Rose is known as an uplifter, especially of the heart. It may help support the body through sickness or grief, heartache or loss, and through times of joy as well. Rose may help bind tissues together and support the healing of wounds and inflamed tissues, and it may help with inflamed digestive tracts. name: Sacred - Herbal Tea
description:
This tea blend was created to support the female body. Whether she is walking through loss or life, this tea can help replenish vital minerals that are often lost during times of stress. The herbs work together to provide gentle support for the reproductive system, helping to promote calm in all stages of life. This tea acts as a warm hug for physical and emotional health for the female body.

Enjoy this tea on a daily basis or as needed.

We recommend savoring a cup during moments of solitude to allow your body to relax and mindfully enjoy each sip.

Chamomile - relaxes the body, soothes gassy tummies, aids in digestion, mild nervine

name: Sage Elixir
description:
Sage is a common garden herb that boasts many medicinal qualities.

Sage is drying, which can help for wet coughs that seem to be deep in the lungs. It can help to increase blood flow and can help the body throughout a fever.

Nursing women are advised to limit their intake of medicinal amounts of sage as it can dry up the milk supply.

Sage is an antiseptic and can help to fight bacteria like strep and candida. It can be taken often for relieving strep throat, and sore throats of all kinds.

It can help with gum issues such as bleeding gums, cold sores, and sore throats.

Sage is traditionally seen as a wise herb, used by elders and wise people, and as such can also be taken for help with brain function. Those with symptoms of Alzheimer's and dementia can benefit from taking sage.

It can help women and menstrual cycles and menopause symptoms. It can bring warmth to the uterus and help to bring relief to painful cramping. Sage can help women walking through menopause as it can help to cool the body.

Sage is a must-have for wintertime and those coughs that seem to sneak up on us as the weather shifts.
