name: Salty Pumpkin & Goat Milk Soap
description:
This is a creamy bar with a gentle lather!

These bars are crafted from organic ingredients. The fats and oils work together to make a dreamy bar of soap. This soap is gentle enough for use on your hands or body and is a gentle degreaser. All ingredients are organic or wildcrafted.

Each bar measures roughly 2" by 3" by 1" (NEW SIZE!) and is approximately 4 ounces by weight

ABOUT — Pumpkin is a cozy addition to a sudsy sea salt soap. Pumpkin contains vitamins that may benefit the skin, and usher in the cooler months.

Sea salt adds a lathering effect to this soap, along with gentle exfoliation! Please note that sea salt may be drying when used daily, so we recommend this as a hand soap or a body soap if followed up with a body oil or tallow balm to prevent over-drying.

SALTY PUMPKIN & GOAT MILK SOAP INGREDIENTS —

  • coconut oil

  • cocoa butter

  • sea salt

  • pumpkin

  • goat milk

  • lye (sodium hydroxide)

  • water

NOTE: This is an unscented soap! It does have clove powder added at the end of the soapmaking process, so the bar may have a slight pie crust/baked goods scent with some gentle exfoliation from the cloves and salt.

name: Scrub Brush
description:
A solid beech wood body with sisal bristles. This brush is plastic-free.

Sisal is made from the fibers of the agave plant (agave sisalana) and the fibers are sturdy enough to scrub away food particles. As the fibers get wet, they become more flexible, making them perfect to clean with.

Beech is a hard wood that is resistant to water. These brushes are not sealed and are toxin-free.

Replace when the bristles are flat and no longer scrub as well as you’d like. We recommend composting the used brush head at the end of its life.

name: Sea Sponge
description:
These sea sponges are sustainably harvested in the ocean. They are harvested by leaving the root of the sponge behind, so more can grow.

Sea sponges are an incredible alternative to plastic sponges and an option that can be used by many due to how the sea sponge roots can regrow after being harvested.

A sea sponge is soft and gentle, and also naturally inhibits the growth of mold, mildew, and bacteria. When properly cared for, sea sponges can live their life without a hint of stink or sliminess that standard plastic sponges can get.

Sea sponges can last anywhere from 3 to 6 months depending on usage. The sponge will start to fall apart at the end of its life. When that happens, simply compost the sponge.

These sponges measure approximately 4.5” by 5” for the large, and approximately 3” by 3” for the small, but size can vary.

These can be used to wash dishes or can be used as a plastic-free sponge in the bath. Allow to dry out between uses for best results.

name: Serenity - Herbal Tea
description:
This tea blend was carefully crafted to soothe an overactive nervous system. The herbs selected have been chosen for their ability to gently calm a racing mind, alleviate panicky thoughts, and restore a sense of balance to the body during stressful times. Just as a refreshing ocean breeze or the serenity of a sunrise brings peace, this tea is crafted to evoke a sense of tranquility and promote calmness within the body.

Enjoy this tea on a daily basis or as needed.

We recommend savoring a cup during moments of solitude to allow your body to relax and mindfully enjoy each sip.

INGREDIENTS: (all organic or wildcrafted)

Chamomile - relaxes the body, soothes gassy tummies, aids in digestion, mild nervine

Lemon balm - mild nervine, lifts emotions, soothes the digestion, eases anxiety

Passionflower - helps with anxiety and restlessness, helps with regulating blood pressure, calms the body

comes in a 1.5 oz pouch, with 16-20 servings

name: Set of Four, Beeswax Tea Lights
description:
These handmade candles are made using cotton, lead-free wicks, and pure beeswax. They smell incredible, burn slowly, and can help to purify the air as they burn. They are the perfect toxin-free candle!

They have a burn time of approximately 3-4 hours.

Trim the wick before each burn. You can trim the wick by pinching off the charred part with your fingers. This ensures your wick won’t burn too fast.

name: Sheepskin 01 - Gotland
description:
ORIGIN: This sheepskin comes from the island of Gotland in Sweden. Only a select number of Gotland sheepskins are processed each year. They are prized for how luxurious they feel! They are thin and silky, not plush like other sheepskin varieties. They feel more silky and have more movement than other sheepskins.

SIZE — Measurements are roughly 45” long by 28” wide

FUR LENGTH — 5”

COLOR — darker grey towards center then lightens with a mix or cream around edges

TEXTURE — Soft, almost silky

THICKNESS — Medium

DISCLAIMER: These are a natural product and as such will have some imperfections that make them unique. This may include: 

  • “armpits” which are on four corners of the sheepskin. Sheep naturally don’t grow fur there so they may appear to be bald patches! 

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality.

FUR LENGTH — 8”

COLOR — Dark brown base with light brown/toffee tips on the fur

TEXTURE — Medium soft texture sheepskin.

THICKNESS — Medium thickness

DISCLAIMER: These are a natural product and as such will have some imperfections that make them unique. This may include: 

  • “armpits” which are on four corners of the sheepskin. Sheep naturally don’t grow fur there so they may appear to be bald patches! 

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality.

description:
ORIGIN — This sheepskin comes from the island of Gotland in Sweden. Only a select number of Gotland sheepskins are processed each year. They are prized for how luxurious they feel! They are thin and silky, not plush like other sheepskin varieties. They feel more silky and have more movement than other sheepskins.

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality.

name: Sheepskin Pet Bed
description:
These pet beds allow your furry friends to snuggle and receive the benefits of sheepskins! These are European sheepskin beds, handmade, and utilize sheepskin scraps so they support the low-waste tanning process.

The sheepskins were tanned using OEKO-TEX certified ingredients and are free from heavy metals and aluminium. They are “vegetable tanned” with natural ingredients, tree bark, and salts.

Many customers have reported that their four-legged friends have found comfort by sitting on their sheepskin. I like to think that it reminds them of their mama and litter when they were babies! It can easily be rolled up to transport to the car, hotels, or other locations.

Lanolin is known to be medicinal and anti-inflammatory, making these a non-toxic and cozy way to help support aches and pains for your furry friends.

MEASUREMENTS — each bed varies in size slightly, but are approximately 20”-24” across with a 10”-12” circle inside for your pet to lay on. They are approximately 6”-8” tall from floor to top of the side walls. They are not padded or stuffed inside, they just have sheepskins rolled onto itself.

COLORS — We offer pet beds in cream and brown. Shades may vary as this is a natural product.

SMELL — The sheepskin will have a slight sheepy smell. This is largely due to the lanolin that is retained after the tanning process, and due to some of the ingredients used in the tanning process. Most customers report that their furry friends enjoy the smell! Please note that you do NOT want an unscented sheepskin as that means it has been stripped of all of the medicinal benefits! Some customers have reported that their pet sees sheepskins as a toy, so please observe your pets to be sure they do not destroy or chew on the sheepskin.

DISCLAIMER: These are a natural product and as such will have some imperfections that make them unique. This may include: 

  • “armpits” which are on four corners of the sheepskin. Sheep naturally don’t grow fur there so they may appear to be bald patches! 

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality.

name: Sheepskin Square
description:
ABOUT

17"x17" approximate measurements

These are sheepskin squares, leftover from the tanning process! Sometimes sheepskins are made into rugs and they have scraps left over, or a full sheepskin was damaged in the tanning process so they salvaged the square. These all vary in texture and thickness but are all cream-colored. Some of these have marks on the back from the tanning process or are sewn together if they received cuts during the process. All are amazing quality!

These fit perfectly on a desk chair or a seat in the car, and are also amazing for all the benefits of the sheepskin without the pricetag of a large one. You can place your baby on this, place it atop your pillow at night, travel with it to make a familiar spot for your kids, or use it as a portable seat! The possibilities are endless!

They are soft, they are cozy, AND they have some medicinal benefits. The fuzzy fiber that gives warmth and protection to sheep is actually healing and beneficial to humans as well. Sheepskins can vary in color depending on the breed of sheep. Sheepskin date back to the beginning of time, with clothes or bedding being fashioned from the skins. Sheepskins were once used to collect gold in riverbeds, prevent bedsores, warm hands and feet in winter, and used to wrap babies up to protect them from bitter winter winds. Many cultures have sheepskin as a normal part of their bedding and clothing. With an incredibly high signature frequency of 5,000 (compared to 100 for the human body), wool can work to uplift the body and not add extra stress that synthetic fibers can add to our bodies. When mixed with linen, which actually also has a signature frequency of 5,000, the two fibers can cancel each other out and collapse the energy field. Because of this, it’s best to pick one fiber or the other and try not to mix the two or wear both at the same time for the best benefits.

My babies LOVE “sheepskin naps.” It is a phrase I started to use a few years ago when my daughter was born. She would rest so deeply and peacefully when she napped on a sheepskin, and from that day onward we started traveling with a sheepskin so she could have a sheepskin nap everywhere we went. My son napped on a sheepskin every day that first year of his life! Sheepskins can also be used for patients staying in their bed for many hours at a time, and those that develop bedsores. Sheepskin helps relieve pressure from the pressure points and works to regulate the body’s temperature, making it a cozy and soft thing to lay on. When looking for a sheepskin, get your nose into the fibers and take a big whiff! The sheepskin should feel soft and fuzzy, not dry, and should have a slight sheep-y smell. This is a good sign that the lanolin is still intact! If you can ask, try to find out if the sheepskin has been bleached, which strips the fibers of lanolin and leaves the fur very white but very dry.

When cared for, a sheepskin can last decades and can be passed along to the generations after you. They are a beautiful heirloom gift. These come from Europe and the skins go through a traditional tanning method referred to as "vegetable tanning." The skins are soaked in salt water, then treated with gentle vegetable-and-plant derived substances. They are free from chromium, formaldehyde, eulan, formalin, PCB, optical brighteners, plasticizers, etc. The lanolin is largely preserved in this method, leaving a good amount of medicinal benefits.

DISCLAIMER: These are a natural product and as such will have some imperfections that make them unique. This may include: 

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality. 

  • Stitching along the backside. These are a zero-waste product, and our tannery stitches up to 2 pieces of sheepskin together. They are expertly connected and do not affect the quality!

name: Sheva Herbal Tea
description:
This tea is a nourishing blend of seven beautiful herbs designed to support the heart and overall well-being. The herbs in this blend speak to a tired or weary heart, one that is grieving, or one needing to refocus and be reminded of wholeness.

Enjoy this tea on a daily basis or as needed.

We recommend savoring a cup during moments of solitude to allow your body to relax and mindfully enjoy each sip.

INGREDIENTS: (all wildcrafted or organic)

Elderflower - a gentle, uplifting herb that can support the immune system

Lemon Balm - is great for supporting immunity and also helps ease sadness and depression, calm the heart, enhance sleep, and aid in memory and concentration.

Hibiscus - helps to lower blood pressure, anti-inflammatory, high in vitamin C

Tulsi (Holy Basil) - an adaptogen and tonic used to protect the heart from stress, can enhance digestion, memory, concentration, and happiness.

Hawthorn berries - strengthens the heart, improves blood flow

Orange Peel - is aromatic and bitter, stimulating appetite and digestion.

Motherwort - calming for the heart and nervous system and offers support for the uterus

Each jar contains 8-10 servings, depending on how strong you like your tea!

Consume as desired, daily, and add honey to taste.

name: Skullcap Tincture
description:
Skullcap is known for its powerful ability to help calm a frazzled nervous system. Skullcap may also support the body in several other ways: it may relieve painful headaches, including hormonal ones, by helping to relax the body and relieve tension. It has been used to help those working through withdrawal symptoms from going off of sleep aids. Skullcap has been used to support those with epilepsy and those with tremors. It is seen as a calming hug to the body. Tension in the body may be supported with skullcap, and those needing extra nervous system support.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Sleep Blend
description:
This blend was crafted to support the body through sleep struggles. The herbs were traditionally used to support insomnia, restlessness, PTSD, anxiety, panicky thoughts, spiraling thoughts, hyperactivity, tension, stress, the liver, hormones, and more. Reishi is a well-studied mushroom that is known for its ability to help the body’s natural hormone production, offer liver support, help to calm the body, and to promote overall vitality. When taken before bed, this blend may help to calm the mind and let the body drift off into a restorative sleep.

Ingredients — Wildcrafted fresh extracts of catnip (nepeta cataria), blue vervain (verbena hastata), hops (humulus lupulus), california poppy (eschscholtzia californica), wildcrafted wood-grown reishi fruiting body (ganoderma lucidum),* grain alcohol, spring water, non-GMO palm-derived glycerin, raw honey *heated for full benefits

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass dropper bottle

description:
ABOUT

They measure approximately 39" long and 25” wide. The size varies and they might be a couple of inches smaller or larger. The fur is thin, around 1-2” in length as it is trimmed down. This variety has a more dense feel to the wool. 

This variety is considered “medicinal” as it contains more lanolin than normal, giving it more of a yellow color. But all sheepskins in our shop are considered medicinal as they have some levels of lanolin! This variety contains the most concentrated amount of lanolin. The sheepskins will range from deeper shades of yellow to lighter shades of yellow and will not be a pure white. 

Due to the extra lanolin, the sheepskin smell will also be stronger than other varieties  

This option may be best for those with newborns who want shorter fur, or those needing extra medicinal benefits from the lanolin. 

ABOUT SHEEPSKINS

They are soft, they are cozy, AND they have some medicinal benefits. The fuzzy fiber that gives warmth and protection to sheep is actually healing and beneficial to humans as well. Sheepskins are typically 3-4 feet long and can vary in color depending on the breed of sheep.

Sheepskin date back to the beginning of time, with clothes or bedding being fashioned from the skins. Sheepskins were once used to collect gold in riverbeds, prevent bedsores, warm hands and feet in winter, and used to wrap babies up to protect them from bitter winter winds. Many cultures have sheepskin as a normal part of their bedding and clothing. With an incredibly high signature frequency of 5,000 (compared to 100 for the human body), wool can work to uplift the body and not add extra stress that synthetic fibers can add to our bodies. When mixed with linen, which actually also has a signature frequency of 5,000, the two fibers can cancel each other out and collapse the energy field. Because of this, it’s best to pick one fiber or the other and try not to mix the two or wear both at the same time for the best benefits.

My babies LOVE “sheepskin naps.” It is a phrase I started to use a few years ago when my daughter was born. She would rest so deeply and peacefully when she napped on a sheepskin, and from that day onward we started traveling with a sheepskin so she could have a sheepskin nap everywhere we went. My son has napped on a sheepskin every day of his life! Sheepskins can also be used for patients staying in their bed for many hours at a time, and those that develop bedsores. Sheepskin helps relieve pressure from the pressure points and works to regulate the body’s temperature, making it a cozy and soft thing to lay on. When looking for a sheepskin, get your nose into the fibers and take a big whiff! The sheepskin should feel soft and fuzzy, not dry, and should have a slight sheep-y smell. This is a good sign that the lanolin is still intact! If you can ask, try to find out if the sheepskin has been bleached, which strips the fibers of lanolin and leaves the fur very white but very dry.

When cared for, a sheepskin can last decades and can be passed along to the generations after you. They are a beautiful heirloom gift. These come from Europe where the skins go through a traditional tanning method referred to as "vegetable tanning." The skins are soaked in salt water, then treated with gentle vegetable-and-plant derived substances. They are free from chromium, formaldehyde, eulan, formalin, PCB, optical brighteners, plasticizers, etc. The lanolin is largely preserved in this method, leaving a good amount of medicinal benefits.

DISCLAIMER: These are a natural product and as such will have some imperfections that make them unique. This may include: 

  • “armpits” which are on four corners of the sheepskin. Sheep naturally don’t grow fur there so they may appear to be bald patches! 

  • Matting. As wool naturally matts in nature to protect the sheep, you may see some matting on the sheepskin. This is naturally occurring in the tanning process and the sign of a natural product! 

  • Shedding. Some shedding is to be expected, just like with natural rugs like jute. You can expect some shedding as wool behaves similarly to hair! 

  • Small patches of fur missing. These are not noticeable to the eye unless you dig deep in the wool and hunt for them! Sometimes sheep have incidents occur that prevent wool from growing back (like rubbing against a tree or getting caught in a fence!) and they do not change or affect the quality of your sheepskin. 

  • Small cuts of scrapes on the leather, or markings on the back. In the tanning process, the leather is scraped clean. No matter how careful the tanners are, some scratches may occur as damp leather is quite sensitive to tears at that stage of the process! When dried and tanned, leather is extremely durable and a small scratch or hole will not affect the quality.

name: Soap Bag
description:
Perfect for storing body soap, this bag is made from sisal and is an amazing exfoliator for the skin. 

Place your bar inside the bag, close the tie, and use as normal! After your shower, hang the bag to dry.

name: Solid Dish Soap Bar
description:
Have you dipped your toes into the world of solid dish soap bars? There is no going back after you do!

Meet our solid dish soap bar.

It cuts through grease, suds up very well, and tackles your dirtiest dishes with ease! This bar soap is made to be one of the most affordable ones on the market, ounce for ounce, so you can make the easy switch to natural dish soap in your kitchen!

Why non-toxic dish soap? Even the best rinse job can still leave behind a bit of residue. Have you ever used a scented dish soap, only to taste it later on the dishes? This dish soap has non-toxic ingredients that are not harmful to the body, even if a little bit is left behind. We don’t use fragrances or essential oils, so the soap smells like…soap! No fragrance is needed to clean your dishes. It is one we trust to use on our dishes and utensils, and our customers love it too!

The dish soap comes in bars that weigh approximately 14 ounces and 8 ounces. Each batch is made by hand at our shop in Redding, California.

Tip from our shop: when the bar of soap is nearing its end, press those scraps onto a new bar and continue to use every piece!

Ingredients — coconut oil, tallow, olive oil, castor oil, sodium hydroxide (lye, which is not in the final product! It converts the fats to soap)

ALTERNATIVE USES FOR THE SOAP:

  • Scrub your sink and bathtub to cut through grime and dirt!

  • Use as a stain pre-treatment for laundry

  • Bring it on your next camping trip! Wash dishes, scrub pots, wash dirty shoes and tent parts, and dry them out before packing them away, mess-free!

name: Spiced Anise Candle
description:
Our herb-infused tallow candles were the first on the market, utilizing scents from herbs and spices without using essential oils.

Our NEW spiced anise tallow and beeswax candle is a proprietary blend of herbs and spices. The ingredients are slowly infused with the tallow and beeswax to produce a yummy finished product! This candle was inspired by my grandpa and his love for black licorice, and all the positive memories I have associated with that scent.

They will not fill the room quite like store-bought candles will, but they have a warm scent and are totally non-toxic.

SCENT PROFILE - This candle has a cozy spice aroma with a hint of anise, clove, and black licorice. The smell is warm and cozy, and has a deeper scent profile than our other candles. We have had people test the candle who hate black licorice and said the scent is pleasant!

CANDLE CARE - For best results, allow the candle to burn to the edge each time it burns. This can take up to 4 hours. This ensures that the candle will burn evenly and won’t create a “tunnel” of beeswax.

Trim the wick before each burn. You can trim the wick by pinching off the charred part with your fingers. This ensures your wick won’t burn too fast.

The candle comes in an 8-ounce amber glass jar with a lid.

name: Spiced Elderberry Elixir
description:
ELDERBERRY

Sambucus nigra

ABOUT:

Elderberry has traditionally been used to help with colds, fevers, and the flu. It works to help activate the immune system, allowing the body to fight off ailments.  Elderberry has been shown to help shorten the length of sickness when taken at the beginning of feeling sick. 

It contains flavonoids that stimulate the immune system. The flavonoids help to block viruses from attaching to host cells in the body. Elderberry can also help increase usrine flow, bring down fevers, and gently purify the blood. 

This elixir contains raw honey and is spiced with organic fresh ginger, cardamom, cloves, and ceylon cinnamon. It has a gentle cardamom-forward flavor with the benefits that all the spices have to offer! Spices can add some extra support during colds and the flu, and can be extra soothing to your stomach and digestive tract.

CONTRAINDICATIONS:

Elderberry is considered safe to be used by babies, pregnant women, nursing women, and all ages. Those with autoimmune diseases might want to start with a drop or two and see how their body feels, before trying larger doses. As always, do your research and feel confident in knowing that herbs are beautiful tools. 

ACTIONS:

Alterative

Antiviral

Decongestant

Diuretic

Febrifuge

DOSAGE:

You can try 1-3ml, 2-3x a day, or as needed throughout the entire course of sickness.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Spiced Herbal Honey
description:
An electuary is a mixture of herbs and raw honey and is a traditional method to consume herbs with ease. The honey beautifully brings the flavors together and suspends the herbs. Electuaries can be thick enough to roll into a lozenge, or thin enough to pour. This electuary falls somewhere in between! It has a paste texture.

This honey was crafted with my favorite beverage (spiced chai) in mind. This blend was also formulated to feel like a warm hug for a frazzled nervous system. The herbs and spices used are known for their warming and soothing effect on the body.

Electuraries can be consumed by the spoonful or can be drizzled over yogurt or stirred into a warm beverage. The texture of an electuary is a little gritty, as you are consuming larger amounts of herbs at once, but delivers the herbs to your body so quickly.

This electuary is earthy, with that spice that you get from a spiced chai.

The honey can be used any way you would normally use honey:

  • Drizzled on pancakes

  • On biscuits with a little butter

  • In cookies or protein bites

  • To sweeten teas

  • As a garnish for a charcuterie board

  • As a dip for fruits like apples or bananas

Serving suggestion is 1 teaspoon (7g) as desired. One teaspoon contains approximately 170mg of ashwagandha and 50mg of chaga.

Ingredients — Raw honey, all organic or wildcrafted cardamom (elettaria cardamomum), ashwagandha (withania somnifera), clove (syzygium aromaticum), ceylon cinnamon, heat-extracted wood-grown chaga fruiting body (inonotus obliquus), ginger (zingiber officinale), vanilla bean (vanilla planifolia)

comes in a 6 oz clear glass jar

name: Spilanthes Tincture
description:
ABOUT:

Known as the “Toothache Plant,” spilanthes can be used to help with gum diseases, swelling, mouth sores, and toothaches. It can be added to water and swished to support oral health. It has also been used to support the body through infections and colds. It may act as an immune system modulator, which can be useful for fighting off illnesses. It has a tingling sensation when taken, showing the alkylamides at work. It may also help to support the digestive tract.

The taste is very tingly on the tongue! 

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

name: Spring Whip
description:
It is back!

My signature springtime tallow creation is back for the season. This will restock from now through the end of May.

“Spring” is made with grass fed tallow, organic cold-pressed jojoba oil, and beeswax. It is slowly infused with reishi mushrooms, marshmallow root, vanilla beans, and pink rose petals, all wildcrafted or organic. It is a beautifully creamy whip that —hear me out—has a texture reminiscent of cheesecake in the BEST of ways. It was formulated with the seasonal transition in mind. Our skin is adjusting after the cold winter days, and might need some extra love in the form of mushrooms, saturated fats, and beeswax to lock all of that moisture in.

This whip smells light and warm, like a slice of cheesecake (I know, I know), or a walk in a garden with a hint of rose at the end.

This whip comes in a 2-ounce glass jar.

Tallow - Rich in saturated fats, this humble ingredient has been used for centuries for skincare, cooking, and more. It contains fatty acids and vitamins that can promote healing and help to moisturize.

Jojoba Oil - This oil more closely resembles a wax, and has similar constituents as the oil our skin naturally produces. It can help to push moisture deeply into the skin while promoting healthy skin and helpiing to reduce age spots and scars.

Beeswax - This honey-scented wax contains some beautiful benefits for the skin. It can act as a barrier to seal in moisture and also provide some healing for the skin.

Reishi - When used externally, reishi can help promote hydration, the fading of dark spots and scars, and can help provide some anti-inflammatory benefits. Reishi is known as the Mushroom of Immortality and can provide benefits for the body internally and externally.

Marshmallow Root - When used externally, marshmallow root can promote healing and help the skin soothe itself. It can be used by those with eczema, dry skin, and rashes or inflammatory responses.

Rose Petals - These fragrant flowers have some beautiful benefits for the skin. When used externally, rose can help to soothe inflamed skin, promote healing, and can help to slow the growth of bad bacteria. They can help to provide anti-inflammatory benefits to the skin.

Vanilla Beans - Vanilla comes from an orchid-like plant. It helps to soothe inflamed skin, promote healing, and help to fade scars and acne spots. The smell is also relaxing for the body.

name: St. John's Wort Tincture
description:
Hypericum perforatum 

ABOUT: 

St. John’s Wort is a pretty, little yellow flower but when crushed, it turns red. 

St. John’s has traditionally been used as an anti-depressant, and was made popular in the 70s. It is known to uplift moods, anxiety, and anything that is weighing you down. It can be used to promote good digestion, ease ulcers, and calm nervous stomachaches. Slow and sluggish body functions, such as hypothyroidism and chronic nervous system diseases, can often be helped with a bit of St. John’s Wort. 

When used externally, it can help promote the healing of wounds, acne, and rashes. 

It is well-known as an uplifter! The sunshine-colored flowers speak to that medicine! 

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

St. John’s Wort contraindicates around 50% of pharmaceuticals on the market. It can cause the liver to kick out any medication taken with it. It is a good idea to check with a doctor before taking St. John’s Wort to be sure it will not cancel out your current medication.

ACTIONS: 

Analgesic

Anti-Inflammatory

Diuretic

Antiviral

Vulnerary

Nervine

Neuroprotective

Anodyne

DOSAGE:

2-3ml a day, or as needed. 

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Strawberry Beeswax Candles
description:
These darling candles look good enough to eat!

Introducing our NEW strawberry beeswax candles as part of our Summer Farmer’s Market candle collection!

This set comes with 4 beeswax strawberry candles, measuring approximately 1.75” tall by 1.75” at the base. They have a burn time of approximately 5-6 hours per candle and burn nearly dripless when kept away from a breeze.

They are crafted with pure beeswax, a lead-free cotton wick, and eco-friendly non-toxic dyes!

They would be darling for:

  • Birthday cake candles

  • Bridal shower candles

  • Baby shower candles

  • A spring/summer picnic candle

  • Or just to enjoy as-is!

The candles come in a set of 4, in a small paper berry basket with some paper shred padding.

name: Strawberry Tonic
description:
This tasty tonic is a good source of vitamins C, A, K, iron, calcium, magnesium, folate, potassium, zinc, and manganese. It can help replenish needed nutrients and may offer your daily dose of vitamins and minerals.

An oxymel is a combination of an acid and honey and is a potent way to extract vitamins and minerals and help the body retain hydration. It can be taken as digestive support before or after meals and as a delicious addition to your daily beverages.


INGREDIENTS
Raw apple cider vinegar, raw honey, fresh strawberries, nettle*, catnip,* tulsi*

*dried

name: Summer Balm
description:
She is back! I formulated this balm with healing ingredients for summertime, when skin is a little extra sun-kissed. This balm contains a small amount of naturally occurring spf and offers healing properties and deeply nourishing oils and herbs.

It can be used on sun-kissed skin, rashes, bites, scars, acne, aging skin, stretch marks, and more! It is not meant to be used as sunscreen and does not contain enough spf for that, but can offer a protective layer on the skin for those spending time in the sunshine. It is deeply moisturizing and a potent healing balm!

INGREDIENTS - Locally sourced tallow, cold-pressed jojoba oil, nilotica shea butter, emu oil, sea buckthorn fruit oil, and beeswax infused with extracts from all wildcrafted calendula flowers, marshmallow root, and helichrysum

name: Sunshine - Summer Herbal Tea
description:
This tart and tangy tea was formulated to capture the vibrance of summer. The herbs and fruits work together to provide needed nutrients, digestive support, and a refreshing addition to your day. The herbs provide much-needed vitamins and minerals to support the body on hot day!

Enjoy this tea on a daily basis or as needed.

We recommend savoring a cup during moments of solitude to allow your body to relax and mindfully enjoy each sip.

INGREDIENTS: (all wildcrafted or organic)

Hibiscus - helps to lower blood pressure, anti-inflammatory, high in vitamin C

Red Raspberry Leaf - aids in the oxygenation of the cells, strengthens the uterine muscles, and helps to relieve and prevent morning sickness.

Lemongrass - a natural diuretic which helps to flush out toxins and reduce bloating.

Dried tart cherries - Tangy and rich in nutrients that can promote calm in the body

Lemon Peel -is aromatic and bitter, stimulating appetite and digestion.

Each jar contains 2 ounces of tea, or 10-12 servings, depending on how strong you like your tea. 

Or each bag contains 4 ounces of tea.

name: Sunshine Oil
description:
Previously named sunshine serum (same formula)

This is a nourishing oil formulated to offer healing resin extracts and soothing botanical extracts to support glowing skin. Apply to skin as a moisturizing layer after a hydrosol, or apply to damp skin and use as an oil cleanser. Can be used on the face or body.

Frankincense is known for its ability to help heal scars, tone the skin, and provide anti-inflammatory benefits.

Calendula is known for its ability to help heal scars, speed the healing of wounds, reduce inflammation, and soothe the skin.

Chamomile is an antioxidant that can help improve uneven skin, soothe breakouts, and help with the skin's overall appearance.

Ingredients - Organic jojoba oil, frankincense resin (boswellia carteri), boswellic acid extract, wildcrafted calendula (calendula officinalis), wildcrafted chamomile (matricaria recutita)

comes in a 1.4 oz amber glass serum bottle with a dropper

name: Sunshine Salve
description:
This all-purpose salve can is filled with skin-supportive resins and herbs that may soothe rashes, help heal scars, support wound-healing, and more!

It is an all-purpose salve that can be used for a wide variety of skin conditions or as a protective balm on the skin.

Frankincense is a gum resin that has a rich history. It was a valuable incense and had nearly 5 times the demand that myrrh had. The scent is almost lemony, with lighter top notes. It was commonly used in temples as it was believed to heighten awareness and elevate thoughts. It was also once decreed by the Jews that only frankincense could be used for holy incense. It has rich medicinal benefits and has been used both internally and externally.

Chamomile flowers are known to be soothing and calming, offering healing support for chapped skin.

Calendula is known as a sunshine flower, supporting skin with antifungal properties, anti-inflammatory properties, and promoting wound healing. It has also traditionally been used to heal scars.

Lavender is known for its calming aroma and ability to also calm skin conditions, support burns, and help with inflammation.

To use as a moisturizer: Apply a hydrosol first, or plain water. While the skin is still damp, apply the salve and gently massage it in to lock in the moisture.

Ingredients — Organic cold-pressed olive oil, wildcrafted frankincense resin, wildcrafted chamomile flowers, wildcrafted calendula flowers, organic lavender buds, beeswax

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass jar

name: Toffee Sheepskin Square
description:
ABOUT

17"x17" approximate measurements

These are sheepskin squares, leftover from the tanning process! Sometimes sheepskins are made into rugs and they have scraps left over, or a full sheepskin was damaged in the tanning process so they salvaged the square. These all vary in texture and thickness but are all cream-colored. Some of these have marks on the back from the tanning process or are sewn together if they received cuts during the process. All are amazing quality!

These fit perfectly on a desk chair or a seat in the car, and are also amazing for all the benefits of the sheepskin without the pricetag of a large one. You can place your baby on this, place it atop your pillow at night, travel with it to make a familiar spot for your kids, or use it as a portable seat! The possibilities are endless!

name: Tremella Elixir
description:
TREMELLA / Bai Mu Er

tremella fuciformus 

This elixir is made with permission using Arielle de Martinez's method. (Her website is here.) Her method utilizes alcohol, heat, and water to extract all the beneficial constituents from tremella. A mushroom supplement should be heated in order to release all the beneficial polysaccharides. 

This elixir contains alcohol, reverse osmosis water, raw honey, and non-GMO, food-grade, palm-derived glycerin. The reverse osmosis water is "hungry" and seeks out minerals, pulling beneficial goodness from the mushrooms. The honey adds a touch of sweetness and medicinal qualities, and the small amount of glycerin helps to suspend the tremella so each dose is a balanced one. The alcohol is necessary for one of the extraction parts, but in the final dose it is a balanced amount of alcohol, water, honey, and glycerin. 

ABOUT: 

Tremella is a white/yellow mushroom that, when dried, resembles a sea sponge. It is nicknamed “Snow Fungus” and is a popular ingredient in Chinese Medicine. It is known as a beautifying mushroom and is even used in a tasty dessert soup to promote healthy, glowing skin. 

Tremella helps to replenish and restore the body. Many believe that consuming it can lead to living a longer life. 

It is immunomodulating and helps to raise an overactive immune system or lower an overactive one. Its polysaccharides have anticancer behavior and can help to promote cancer cell death. There are studies that show it works well with cancer treatments. 

Tremella’s “beautifying” nickname comes from the antioxidants that can help fight aging at a cellular level. It can stimulate “Superoxide Dismutase” which is known to protect the skin and help to slow signs of cellular aging. It is more effective than Hyaluronic acid and holds 5x as much water as hyaluronic acid does. It can help promote plump, glowing skin when consumed daily. It helps skin elasticity, skin tone, can brighten complexion, and moisturizes and nourishes the skin. 

It is a lung tonic and can be used to provide coolness and dampness to the lungs which can help with dry coughs and muscle spasms from coughing. It can help rehydrate congestion and allow it to come up and out of the body. Tremella has radio protective properties and can be used alongside cancer treatments to help reduce the damage of prolonged radiation. 

Tremella is 90% polysaccharides and forms almost a jelly-like substance when in contact with water or when fresh. Tremella can be used to help heal the GI tract and allow for a healthy level of good bacteria to thrive in the GI tract. As a nutritive, tremella can replenish the body, build blood, and help with converting vitamin D in the body. 

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

No reported contraindications. 

ACTIONS: 

Adaptogenic

Immunomodulating

Anti-c@ncer

Radioprotective

Beautifying

Expectorant

Demulcent

Nutritive

DOSAGE: 

Use intuitively. You can try taking 1-3 dropperfuls a day. For children, you can try 1 dropperful, a day and adjust as needed.

name: Tulsi Elixir
description:
Tulsi is in the mint family, and also called "Holy Basil." It is sweet and fragrant, with a bit of a spicy-sweet taste. Tulsi can help to gently stimulate the immune system, can act as a digestive aid, immune system regulator. digestive aid, and as a nervine to calm the body and invite it to slow down. Tulsi can help those with anxiety, ADD and ADHD, head trauma, and diabetes. It can help to bring clarity to the mind and was shown in a double-blind placebo-controlled human study to improve cognitive abilities. Short-term memory was also improved in that study.

It can relieve gas, a stuck digestive tract, and help with lung complaints. For asthma and bronchial complaints, tulsi can help to reduce the histamine response.

Several studies have shown that tulsi can help those with diabetes as it can help to stabilize blood sugar. Some diabetics were able to successfully lower their fasting blood sugar glucose. It can help to uplift the body and move along "stuck" energy.

It can be used internally and externally to help treat fungal infections and can also help those exposed to radiation, reducing the side effects.

Tulsi can help the body adjust to the stressors of life and is useful for mamas and those in a high-stress environment.

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

trametes versicolor

This elixir contains alcohol, reverse osmosis water, raw honey, and non-GMO, food-grade, palm-derived glycerin. The reverse osmosis water is "hungry" and seeks out minerals, pulling beneficial goodness from the mushrooms. The honey adds a touch of sweetness and medicinal qualities, and the small amount of glycerin helps to suspend turkey tail so each dose is a balanced one. The alcohol is necessary for one of the extraction parts, but in the final dose, it is a balanced amount of alcohol, water, honey, and glycerin. 

ABOUT: 

Turkey tail is a well-studied mushroom. It is naturally very dry and kind of resembles an earthy-colored tail. 

It has been studied extensively for its anti-c@nc3r properties and its ability to also support the body in shrinking tüm0rs. It has been shown to support the body while it goes through chemo and radiation and help speed up the outcome. 

Turkey tail can help with viruses like HIV, HPV, EBV, and other reoccurring viruses. It can help increase the body's immune response and inhibit the infection in a few ways. 

Turkey tail can be taken regularly. 

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/12168863/

https://undergroundhealthreporter.com/turkey-tail-mushroom/

CONTRAINDICATIONS: 

No negative reactions to Turkey Tail have been documented. It is considered safe to use by all ages, including women who are pregnant. 

ACTIONS: 

Anti-c@ńcêr

Anti-tūm0r

Anti-viral

Anti-microbial

Immunomodulator

Immunostimulant

DOSAGE: 

You can try taking 2-3 dropperfuls, 2x a day. For children, you can try 1 dropperful, 2x a day, and adjust as needed.

name: Uplifting Mist
description:
Hydrosols are steam-distilled plant extracts. They contain the water-soluble constituents of the plant.

TULSI — Tulsi (Holy Basil) has been known to promote clear thinking, reduce stress, and uplift the mind.

ROSE — Roses are synonymous with love and with gardens. They have been used for centuries in skincare and supplements to support the body inside and out. Roses are rich in vitamin c which might promote collagen production and help to promote healthy, glowing skin. The scent is uplifting and calming.

ORANGE — Orange is known for its antibacterial, antimicrobial, and anti-fungal benefits as well as its uplifting scent. It is also rich in vitamin c

Together, these plants and flowers work to gently hydrate the skin.

To use, spritz on skin liberally as needed.

This comes in a 2-ounce amber glass spray bottle

name: Valerian Root Tincture
description:
ABOUT: 

Valerian root can be used to help promote restful sleep, ease anxiety and nervous tension, support healthy stress response, calm an overactive mind, soothe muscle spasms, ease menstrual discomfort, support digestive health, reduce headache tension, promote emotional wellbeing, help with restlessness, improve sleep quality, relax the nervous system, and enhance overall relaxation. It is great for those with cool skin and feeble circulation, and those needing to calm nervous excitement and nervous headaches or migraines. For those with worrying thoughts, valerian may be supportive in calming the mind.

ACTIONS: 

Analgesic

Anti-inflammatory

Anxiolytic

Antispasmodic

Carminative

Hypotensive

Hypnotic

Neuroprotective

Nervine

Sedative

A NOTE ABOUT OUR STANDARDS — All of our tinctures and elixirs (except for the mushroom elixirs) are made with 100-proof alcohol (grain alcohol and local spring water) and fresh plant material. For elixirs, they are made with 100-proof alcohol, raw honey, and fresh plant material.

We source fresh plants from California, from farmers who practice organic farming or “beyond organic” farming practices. All herbs are made into extracts within 24 hours of being picked, so they are extra potent!

We use fresh plants to preserve both water- and alcohol-soluble constituents that are lost when the plant is dried. Fresh plants make for a more potent extract and preserve the life force of the plant in the season it was meant to produce in.

Tincture = alcohol + herb

Elixir = alcohol + raw honey + herb

name: Vanilla Bundle
description:
Vanilla Serum

This serum is made with organic, cold-pressed jojoba oil and a touch of castor oil. It is infused with vanilla beans and rose hips using a dual-extraction method that yields a very potent finished product! It smells like vanilla cookies.

Vanilla beans can help with acne, aging skin, cuts, and wounds, and promote overall health for your skin.

Rosehips contain vitamin C, antioxidants, vitamin E, and other nutrients that help to promote healthy, glowing skin. It can also help speed up healing for your skin and target scars, age spots, and hyperpigmentation.

Vanilla Tallow 

This balm was made by infusing tallow with whole vanilla beans, allowing the vanilla to be extracted through a 2-step process, leaving the tallow gently scented with its warm aroma. 

In addition to smelling like vanilla, this balm can be used to promote glowy skin and help heal any small cuts or scrapes, or skin irritations. I formulated it for use on the face. 

The scent is light and gentle, and leaves behind a hint of vanilla.

name: Vanilla Oil
description:
This is a calming oil formulated to support inflamed skin, offer a calming scent, and offer nourishing botanical and mushroom extracts.

Rose hips are rich in vitamin c, which is supportive for healthy and glowing skin

Vanilla beans are supportive for the skin, to help reduce scarring and promote healthy skin

Tremella is known as the beauty mushroom, supporting glowing and plump skin

Ingredients - Organic jojoba oil, organic castor oil, wood-grown tremella fruiting body (tremella fuciformis), wildcrafted vanilla bean (vanilla planifolia), organic rose hip (rosa canina)

comes in a 1.4 oz amber glass serum bottle with a dropper

name: Vanilla Serum
description:
I created this serum to capture the essence of vanilla and that yummy scent! The serum has a beautiful vanilla aroma that is reminiscent of sugar cookies.

This serum is made with organic, cold-pressed jojoba oil and a touch of castor oil. It is infused with vanilla beans and rose hips using a dual-extraction method that yields a very potent finished product!

Vanilla beans can help with acne, aging skin, cuts and wounds, and promote overall health for your skin. It can be used on the face or body. I like to use it as a makeup remover and follow that with oil cleansing with the serum.

Rosehips contain vitamin C, antioxidants, vitamin E, and other nutrients that help to promote healthy, glowing skin. It can also help speed up healing for your skin and target scars, age spots, and hyper-pigmentation.

name: Vanilla Tallow Balm
description:
This dreamy balm is made by slowly infusing tallow and organic, cold-pressed jojoba oil and emu oil with whole vanilla beans, allowing the vanilla to be extracted through a potent 2-step process. This leaves the tallow gently scented with that warm, vanilla aroma and all the anti-inflammatory and skin-loving benefits.

In addition to smelling like vanilla, this balm can be used to promote glowy skin and help heal any small cuts or scrapes, or skin irritations. It was formulated for use on the face, but it can also be used on the rest of the body.

The scent is vanilla-rich. The texture is smooth and creamy, and easy to spread.

To use our tallow balms: Apply a hydrosol first, or plain water. While the skin is still damp, apply the tallow balm and gently massage in to lock in the moisture.

Ingredients — Organic, cold-pressed jojoba oil, grass-fed house-rendered tallow, wildcrafted vanilla beans, emu oil, beeswax

comes in a 2-ounce amber jar

name: Waldorf Hand-Dipped Beeswax Candles
description:
These candles smell of pure honey and beeswax.

They are hand-dipped using a lead-free cotton wick.

They measure around 6” tall and come in a set of 8, in a cotton drawstring bag. They were dipped to fit a Waldorf celebration ring, but also would make a sweet birthday candle, meditation candle, or cozy nighttime reading candle.

The burn time is approximately 3 hours per candle.

name: White Pine Elixir
description:
Pinus strobus

ABOUT:

With its fresh, clean taste, white pine is an evergreen herb that is a great addition to your wellness cabinet. 

White Pine can be used when working through respiratory and bronchial complaints, as it can help dry and thin the mucus from the lungs, especially green mucus. It is useful for removing mucus that needs to be expelled from the lungs. The resin from the needles can also help to heal the tissue after excessive amounts of coughing. 

When used externally, it can be a warming circulatory stimulant for cold, winter nights. It can be massaged into the skin in areas that need warmth or lymphatic support. It can also be used to clean wounds and help prevent infections. 

As emotional support, white pine can be taken to help open the lungs which can become smaller in times of grief.

CONTRAINDICATIONS:

None known. 

ACTIONS:

Expectorant

Astringent

Circulatory stimulant

Mild diuretic

Mild antiviral 

Immune stimulant

Grief support

name: Wild Lettuce Tincture
description:
Sometimes referred to as, "Poor Man's Opiate" the wild lettuce plant contains a latex that holds pain-relieving properties within it.

This is why it can only be tinctured and used with the fresh plant, while the latex is still intact.

It can be used by those needing sleep support, those needing to calm an overactive nervous system, by those with dry coughs or whooping cough, those with colic pain and uterine pain, and those with muscular and joint pains. It is a powerful relaxant and can be used to calm down a body that is doing too much and cannot seem to rest. Similar to how the body responds to opiates, wild lettuce invites the body to calm down without the side effects of narcotics.

name: Winter Tallow
description:
This tallow whip is infused with resins, herbs, and spices that are all known for their skin-supportive properties.

Frankincense is a gum resin that has a rich history. It was a valuable incense and had nearly 5 times the demand that myrrh had. The scent is almost lemony, with lighter top notes. It was commonly used in temples as it was believed to heighten awareness and elevate thoughts. It was also once decreed by the Jews that only frankincense could be used for holy incense. It has rich medicinal benefits and has been used both internally and externally.

Pine resin is known for its antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties, traditionally used to help heal wounds and also soothe sore muscles.

Orange peel has skin-supportive properties that may help to brighten the skin.

Cloves are a warming spice that supports healthy circulation.

Lanolin is the fat from sheep’s wool, known for its high-frequency and ability to help soothe inflamed skin conditions. It is a deeply healing fat that locks in moisture and promotes wound-healing.

The whip has a smooth, creamy texture that is heavy and rich.  It was formulated as an intense moisturizer for the cold, dry winter months, and is a potent extraction. Beeswax helps to seal in moisture, and the resins help to heal the skin. It smells like resin with a hint of flowers and a hint of the lanolin smell.

Use liberally, as needed! This may help skin conditions, inflamed parts of the face or body, rashes, dry skin, and can even act as a barrier before going out in the cold to prevent windburn! It is deeply moisturizing and is an extra-thick balm that provides a beautiful layer on the skin.

Ingredients — Grass-fed house-rendered tallow, organic cold-pressed jojoba oil, USP-grade lanolin, wildcrafted frankincense resin, wildcrafted pine resin, organic orange peel, organic cloves, beeswax

comes in a 2-ounce amber glass jar

name: Wooden Baby Brush
description:
Made from wood and animal hair, this brush is ultra soft and perfect for using on those tender newborns.

Comes from Germany

name: Wool Drying Mat
description:
Our dish drying mat is an all-natural option for your sink area. It retains moisture as your dishes dry, wool is naturally antimicrobial, absorbs moisture, and evaporates it.

The light grey color is practical for long-term use with water, coffee stains, etc. Handmade in New Orleans with Cruelty-Free South American 100% Wool Felt

How to care for: Soak in cold water with light soap, spot clean food stains. Can lay to dry on the counter or in the sunshine. If you wash in the dishwasher, it will shrink around 1/4" overall (in our tests). Pro tip: Do not put in your clothes dryer on hot, that will turn wool objects into miniatures.

It is incredibly absorbant, but I recommend washing it first before using, as it has a bit of a wool smell that can transfer to the bottom of dishes. Washing it should eliminate that and make it a great, sustainable, long-lasting drying mat! At the end of its life it can be composted which I LOVE that about it. You know my love affair with wool by now, so little-by-little I am woolifying our house and home!

Measures 18" by 14" by 0.3" thick

name: Wool Puddle Pad
description:
Wool rectangle pad: 33” x 15” NEW SIZE, it is one inch smaller on one size, one inch longer on the other!

Wool square pad: 32” x 32” NEW SIZE!

Wool oval pad: 27” x 12”

Wool felted pad: 26” x 11”

NOTE: these each have a price change! Our supplier has raised prices, so we have raised ours to reflect that.

Organic Wool fiber is naturally resistant to bacteria, mites, and even water. Wool is a natural barrier to keep baby dry and comfortable. It has a high frequency which makes it a fiber that supports the body. Wool has been said to support good sleep patterns and overall health in the body. The natural lanolin (a waxy substance that coast the wool strands) has anti-inflammatory properties and helps to make the wool water-resistant. Wool fibers are hollow, which means they can help wick away moisture.

Use between a fitted sheet and mattress or futon, or by itself. The felted pad is thicker and can be used as a changing mat on the go ro at home! The oval and rectangle mats are more of a wool fabric feel, whereas the felted pad is thicker!

Washing instructions: Hand rinse using cool water. Use very little if any mild detergent, lay flat to dry.

Suggested uses:

  • On the bed for potty training

  • As a diaper-changing mat

  • An intimacy blanket for the bed

  • Underneath babies prone to blowouts

  • For diaper-free tummy time for little ones

100% organic wool milled in USA. Undyed.

name: Wool Sponges
description:
100% natural wool sponges! They are effective and naturally resist odors and mildew.

To use, rinse the sponge with water the first time. If using solid dish soap, rub the sponge across the soap to build up a lather, then wash dishes as normal. If using liquid dish soap, apply some to the sponge and wash as usual. After using them each time, rinse them and squeeze to get rid of excess moisture. Hang to dry or lay flat on the counter.

Over time, these will shrink into a slightly smaller square and will “felt” even more, or develop a tighter weave. That is normal!

  • 100% Climate Beneficial™ wool, sourced from Northern California farms

  • Clean: wool exhibits natural antimicrobial properties

  • Durable: no tearing or crumbling away

  • Long-Lasting: users report 6 months to a year per sponge

  • Easy-to-Clean: soap & warm water when finished using, leave out to dry

  • Non-Polluting: wool is a non-synthetic fiber that does not shed microplastics into our waterways

  • Not Smelly: wool is naturally odor-repelling

  • Compostable: wool biodegrades to build better soil

comes in a pack of two

name: Wound Spray
description:
This spray can be used as a first-aid spray to clean wounds, support wound-healing, and help to stop bleeding.

Yarrow is known for its ability to kill gram-positive bacteria, leaving beneficial bacteria behind. It is known for its ability to help stop bleeding quickly and was traditionally used by Native Americans to treat all kinds of skin conditions. It was also used in ancient Rome to treat spear wounds.

Goldenrod is known for its antiseptic properties, supporting wound-healing while helping to prevent infection.

Witch hazel is known as an astringent, best for skin conditions that need to be dried up or soothed. 

Ingredients - Fresh or dried yarrow infused in witch hazel, goldenrod extract (wildcrafted goldenrod, 100-proof grain alcohol)

name: Yarrow Salve
description:
A perfect addition to any first-aid kit.

This salve can be used as a natural antibiotic ointment. It can be used to stop bleeding, help heal cuts and scrapes, and calm wounds.

This salve comes in a 2-ounce tin.

name: Yarrow Tincture
description:
Achillea millefolium

ABOUT: 

Often considered to be “first aid in a bottle,” yarrow was commonly used to stop bleeding. In ancient Roman times, yarrow was said to be used to quickly stop bleeding in spear wounds while soldiers were engaged in war.

Yarrow can help to either start bleeding or stop bleeding. When used externally, it can promote wound healing and stop bleeding. Yarrow can kill gram-positive bacteria like Staph.aureus, Bacillus subtillis, Mycobacterium smegmatis, Escherichia coli, Shigella sonnei, and Shigella flexneri. When taken internally, yarrow can be used to encourage the start of a period that is late (that is not delayed due to pregnancy.) Internally, it can help promote healthy blood circulation. 

Yarrow is a bitter herb by nature, which can promote healthy digestion when taken half an hour before meals. 

Yarrow can be used as an anti-inflammatory supplement to help with pain relief. 

When swished in the mouth, yarrow helps with bacteria that can lead to gum disease and bad breath. 

ACTIONS: 

Anti-inflammatory

Analgesic

Antimicrobial

Astringent

Bitter

Diaphoretic

Stimulant
